comments_raw: Delightful puzzles. I got all the way to the end! Didn't expect the twist, cool story beat. I honestly don't know if I have any critique. The puzzles were quick to restart if something went wrong and I feel all the criteria were well incorporated. Great job ð

Superb, one of the entries that humble me when I see how well some people can fulfill the round's criteria. I can't see level's number but I'm probably near the end and it is quite enjoyable experience.
This is one of my favorites from the round!  The voice acting and story snippets were great, and the puzzle mechanics were super solid.  Full five stars from me!

Amazing Work! All the mechanics are really intuitive, yet can be really unique. I beat the last level without ever touching a button, like the VA didn't even finish there sentence before the robot walked into a laser, but the previous 9 levels made up for 110% of any finale. Great work!

Amazing work. Nice voice acting! The art style was simple but readable and pleasant to look at, perfect for a puzzle game in my opinion. I loved how you could adjust all the elements of the map AND move the dog around.

That was just fabulous! Great job! I really have nothing to add. :)
the game looks and plays coolthe only thing that it lacks is the animal chracter becose the player character doesnt count

Excellent job as always!  You had a really impressive amount of polish here, and the level design did a really good job of introducing the mechanics over time.
Very enjoyable, cute story and well thought projectile mechanics, nice job!

Great game - very polished!  I absolutely love the spider friend. really clever use of an animal and I love the mechanic for when the spider broke boxes and retrieved the ball.  The only challenge for me was missing a shot and then having to go next to the enemy to get my ball for a second shot.  Lastly, great story, I played all the way to the end and just wish there was more.  This is one of my favorites so far and I hope you get to continue it.

First of all, the art is gorgeous (as expected). The tie in with Crunkle's was unexpected but fun. I think that the animals and projectiles were done exceedingly well, as both have multiple uses and both have uses that tie in with one another, amazing job with that. The story wasn't as integrated with the gameplay as I might have liked. Also minor nitpick but I don't think a single one of the signs was ever helpful to me, every one I read I'd already discovered the mechanic for myself, which was more fun in my opinion. They were probably a good inclusion for any players that didn't figure out the mechanics but for me personally they kind of took away immersion. This really came together as a complete product so great job with that, wonderful work!

That was pretty fun! The story felt a bit random at times but it was enjoyable nonetheless. Seeing the spider barge through boxes was pretty unexpected and a funny game mechanic. Overall a pretty nice game :D good job!
Fun art style. We thought of a similar concept somewhere (like an animal friend going to fetch stuff for you and puzzles based on that). But our implementation is flawless. Loved it.

The shooting mechanic was fun, and worked really well with the animal companion. I really liked how the projectile had weight to it, felt really purposeful when I was shooting it. The art is gorgeous and the progression is tight with a nice easy to remember backtrack path that makes the world feel really open. It was also a really good length for a jam game, long enough to give an experience but short enough to not outstay its welcome. bug free too. I look forward to the next episode!super awesome job!
Such an awesome game, I love to see the tie in with Crunkle's Sideshow!
I love the art style. Reminds me of Bomberman Quest in a way. Fun mechanics, and my playthrough way bug free, unless you count the spider as a bug. I have no criticism.

Half expecting an owl like figure to tell me where to go to find the master sword. The story was really cool and loved how you've made it as a spin off to a larger universe. Projectile system was perfect for the task and you nailed the criteria for this round. Awesome job.
Great game and story
Love the chunkiness of the art style!

Throwing the ball and having the creature bring it back to violet is a really cool mechanic, especially with how you expanded the mechanic to directing the creature to smashing the crates. I like the story too and it's good to see crunkle again :)
Great game and story! The projectile and spider work well together. I really like the art style.

Well deserved 5 star rating. Really good job! I like how the spider has multiple purposes, even breaking walls i cant traverse without it. Great story too and it fits so well into the universe you built with your other games. :)

Very cute polished game! The art is amazing and once I knew what the spider could do I even loved it more. It would be cool if the spider could damage too so you can shoot 2 balls to create some sort of track for it to follow and damage enemies on it

comments_raw: This was a really impressive game, and your mechanics worked great!  I found that when I tried to slide under one of the swords from the trap, the character automatically stood back up after sliding instead of staying crouched, so I got hit a bunch by sliding instead of crouching by accident, so I would recommend crouching after a slide, but that's just a little nitpicky thing.  Great game!
I really want to see this being expanded on! Liked the story and the gameplay. Smart and unique!
It's still an impressive mechanism. The story and map go well together.

I really liked this platformer a lot.  I think you did a great job of teaching us how to play.  And, I really liked that the difficulty wasn't that hard.   The spear mechanic was also very cool, both for killing and for getting to higher areas.  Really well done.

Well done ! I like the whole look and setup of the game. I did not pass the part where i had to dodge projectible and fighting monster at the same time. But i definitely want to try again. well done !

This game has come a long way from round 1. The platforming was overall very enjoyable, I did struggle with the section when you have to climb the pillar using multiple spears. Great job!
Great spear mechanics!

Another metroidvania! This was cute but everything just felt slow, especially with the amount of times you need to navigate back and forth through the same areas. I really liked having the central mechanic of a spear that you upgrade throughout the game but the dog as a mechanic felt horrible and was very glitchy, the part where you need to use it on the button I just skipped over. The spear being used for both platforming and combat was neat but the combat was lacking and with only a limited amount of enemies in the game that don't respawn I was left wanting a little more.  Having most of the falls result in you just having to repeat a section you've already done several times was a little bit cruel. I still got some enjoyment out of it, though. Overall, nicely done.

Almost everything out the movement feels great! With the exception of the spears, they feel overall slow. This game was extremely satisfying to play, it feels great to break the rocks up with my laser and collect the materials and then upgrade. Great game loop. You have the basis for a really cool game here.
Nice game but no projectile :sad-duck:

The mechanics so sooooo satisfying, I remember this one from Round 1. The upgrades ramp up quickly enough to not get old and then you've got this piercing laser just crushing ores. Feels great.Shame you didn't get to add everyone you wanted, but whats there feels really good!

I love the skill tree. The first thing I did was max everything out, then I was like "Wait, the duck told me to go somewhere...." It feels great to play. Bummer that you ran out of time but the story that's there was cool.
super game projectly system was great,animal and story  chracter were ok but apart from that realy good game

I'm really happy to see you continuing the game from last round! I'm sorry to hear that you weren't able to finish it, but what is here is incredible solid, polished and I couldn't find a single bug! I really hope to see you take this game even further in future rounds!

Sounds like it was a pretty rough development cycle but it still came out nicely. Breaking the rocks was still incredibly satisfying and having do so to explore the map and find your way out was a nice addition. While the game felt a bit incomplete, it still left me feeling as if I had a full experience and I had fun, which is nice. I liked the little duck too (^)> great job!
Ahh so happy to see this game come back! The intro cutscene was very cute.
I remember playing the version of this game for last round and you've made some good improvements. Fun game!
This was great! I wish there was more story. Sad too see only one part, but I understand the business that has come upon everyone this week.
Oscar for best original story )

Awesome game. Superb story. And LOTS of math. Every time a new mechanic was introduced, it was given ample time for the player to learn what they do. Some levels felt much easier than others, but overall the game stayed at a nice difficulty curve that never swayed to far in either direction. Excellent work!
this game should be mandatory for schools i love it.
Yep... math is still hard.
I would definitely buy a "full version" of this. The world needs more cool math games <3

Seriously, unique and original game.  I can't believe how much you were able to create and pack in here during a game jam.  The cut scenes were awesome.  The humor throughout is great.  And, I love math games (as evidenced by my game "PEMDAS" in the first round).  Really well done.  I hope you get to move on.
That intro scene is the most amazing thing I have ever seen, combined with the music. Very clever and even poetic.

Top marks from me. Loved it. I was a little daunted at first because of how many puzzles you said there were, but they were quick to get through so it didn't take too long. Funny story, good puzzles, and a great game.
This was really cool and had a truly impressive amount of polish!  That's five stars across the board from me!!

Amazing game and story! At first, I thought the math would be simple, but I'm glad it got more and more complicated as the game progressed. All the art and the funny story added some absurdity to this math game and made it very enjoyable. Great job!
I do not think, therefore I do not am.

The story is very engaging and definitely kept me all the way to the end. I'll admit that I had to skip a lot because the math got pretty complex, especially as I've never heard of things like abs. It was good watching the pigeon follow the path but the story is what is the main thing for me, great job with the art and dialogue!

This game does so many things right, it has a funny story, an unique mechanic, could defintely be on coolmathgames, has bonus levels (that aren't mandatory) and has nice soundtrack to go with it. Good job!

Ok this was hilarious. Excellent storytelling and I love how the pigeon projectiles are math functions :D Halfway through the game I learned to embrace some delicious sinus wave cheese spam so I didn't solve the puzzles as intended, and I'm sure the pigeons would be concussed if they could think. But obviously they can't.

Having read some of Descartes previous to this game, I could not stop laughing. I want you to make a game with this type of narrative for every type of ancient mathematician. Actually, I want this kind of narrative for any historical figure ever. Well done, perfect game IMO

I loved this reimagining of Descartes. I studied Philosophy at University and got a real kick out of the story! Extremely original and humorous. I'm not a big math guy but the mechanics were well implemented and can't really find any faults with this game at all. I got about halfway through the game, I was waiting to see if there would be some kind of pun to do with "Cogito Ergo Sum", maybe it happened later or I missed it. Great work!

Initially, I was hesitant to play your game because of the math, but I'm glad I finally gave it a try. Your unique take on the task for this round was impressive. I especially appreciated the option to skip puzzles; my old brain wasn't functioning well this morning. The original story captivated me and kept me engaged until the end. Well done!

Wow. You made math fun. Going into this I wasn't sure what to expect and was kind of disappointed at first, but quickly fell in love with the game. It's so simple yet there's a lot of depth, especially in the optional levels which are a really great addition. The writing and story is great and the art serves as a great vessel to move it forward. I really like the trig and absolute value questions, I think that's when I really started enjoying myself. I'm going to be honest I'm surprised but this is one of my favorites so far, well done!

You sir are the worst kind of scoundrel, forcing us to learn math just to find out what happens when he gets to Sweden.  In all honesty though, I didn't play many games yet but this one feels like top 3 to me, it was a joy. Excellent writing, inventiveness, and though graphics are simple they are fitting the time period. Seriously, this story goes places, I'd recommend everyone to play through. The only complaint, maybe the 2nd level in the third optional branch is unsolvable, but I could be just stupid.

Absolutely amazing! I was scrolling through the list and saw Descartes and maths, so had to play it first this round! Loved the way you used the story to blend with the mathematics to blend with the jokes!Full marks from me! Great work on the narrative, the art, the jokes, wow! Also the branching/harder questions were a great touch, parallel to the story
Awesome work!

I wish the knife was more usable as a melee weapon, but it's range is genuinely so bad you are damn near forced to throw it constantly, and given how there are zero repercussions for spamming the throw button, it leads to the melee combat feeling underwhelming. Which is a shame, as I LOVE melee combat. It was fun game nonetheless. It's fairly rare to see a 3D Game, so great work!

I love old school Doom and I really enjoyed this game.  Although, it actually reminded me more of Castle Wolfenstein (which I also love).  Anyway, this was a lot of fun and the rat made for a nice change of pace challenge.  Oddly, this might have been one of the few games I think was a little too easy, but I'm sure if you continue it, you can begin to ramp up the challenges.  Really well done!

Cool game! I never used melee because throwing the knives felt way more useful :D and I also love the hyper intelligent rat companion avoiding death blenders just to help you out. Enemies could be a bit more threatening as they felt very passive right now.

This was really great!!  The rat for opening doors was a really great way to follow the prompt that built the story as well.  One thing I will say is that I really never found a use for the melee attack since I had infinite knives and the melee hit didn't seem to do more damage.  For this jam I don't think that matters, though!  Great job!
Absolutly love the visual but I think that there should be more enemies in the rooms
I love the style of this. I can't think of a single thing I dislike. Well done!
It was lot of fun to talk to my rat fren and get them to open doors. I would love to see you continue to develop this ;)
I love retro fps games. And here you nailed the aesthetic, the ambience and the SFX. The monster designs are really cute, and I liked the rat platforming (ratforming?) sections.
Wow amazing job!
Was great to play on stream ! Thanks for submitting! Please feel free to watch for comments there (around 01:09:40)

I loved the style of game, I made one myself that I called "Doomish" a few years back for a game dev challenge. Good story and controlling the rat was great. Fun game. Too bad some bugs got in the way of the fun.
In memory of Jerry, haha!

Love me a boomer shooter. I think you've got a recipe for something really cool here, it just needs a killer soundtrack and fleshing out a little more. You nailed the DOOM visuals and feel of the game. I thought the rat tunnels mechanic was really fun, clever way to fit the task into your game. I had fun. Well done man!
I just gave this a try. I liked it overall. I like the precision required on the rat segments and throwing the knives.
Considering the time you took, this is a fairly great game! The trash is satisfying to throw, the picture is fun to paint, and the frog is nice. By all accounts, this is great!

First off, the frog is adorable.  Second, I love throwing paper into the trash.  This was a fun and original take on the genre.  I wish there was a bit more to the story and maybe a second challenge on the throwing like a breeze or a frog tongue getting in the way.  But, even as is, this was a lot of fun.  Well done.
Just delightful and fun :) I like it a lot.
I got stuck and game freze propably because of this:
This was a heartwarming little story. Thank you so much.
Everything work pretty well together, well done!

Really nice short and sweet game. I got a few dunks which felt good to build up confidence and the frog is a lot of fun. All the elements in the game work really well together. Here's my final frog portrait :)
Cute relaxing game. Not sure if it's cheating, but I had to use my drawing tablet to complete the drawng. Fun game.
Cute relaxing game that fits the criteria perfectly, good job!
I found this relaxing to play. Cute too. Great job. You've got the projectile and animal connected elegantly ð
This was a cute and simple game! You've reminded me that game jams don't need to be some crazy complicated thing. Well done!

A funny and creative game! I enjoy your frog cinematic universe and the story is very different from your typical game jam stories, so you get a lot of bonus points for that.  I'm not 100% sure how to get more confiedence tho, I feel like even after speaking with the frog and throwing drawings to the trash, I still only managed to draw as much as previously :')

Unusual combo but it works! At first I though the "confidence" was time based, so I had to try and draw both accurate and fast, sadly this wasn't the case. (I think it would've made the gameplay more interesting!)
What a charming little game! It's a very creative way to combine the projectile and the animal. Great job!
I really suck at drawing. And dunking my scrunched up failed portraits into the waste bin :( I had fun playing this game though. You followed the task well. Good work!

Interesting game! I feel like this could be a great horror game or meta game if you decide to develop it further. I like that you can shoot the win text, and I was kind of hoping there would be something more after shooting it.
Great game with a great story. Felt like Elmer Fudd going duck hunting to hell and back. And then shooting the "The End" text. Loved it. So much fun, well done.
I love this game. The simple little story is so funny, I only wish the game lasted longer!

Even the ghost duck is not safe from my bullets of retribution. Although I do wonder what the poor duck did to deserve such treatment...Great interpretation of the task, it was simple but effective. Good job!
Screw GDKO, this is game of the year!
This was cute! Clever storytelling, simple and fun game, what's not to love?

Okay but you really manage to tell a story without using any words and that makes me impressed. I'm not going to spoil anything but I actually laughed a multiple times, a wonderful duck hunt parody game.Especially the third duck was amazing, I added it to my personal "things that bring joy"-file so I can look at it whenever I feel sad.
Really fun game! A bit hard to control but easier to control than katamari haha.
Wow, the modeling work done for this game is incredible! I found the game to be a little too easy, but I still found the game enjoyable.
The intro animation was excellent, I loved how the story was introduced :D
Amazing work!

Struggled in the aiming training. But fun game. I dont know how did you manage to add cutscenes and music and everything in so much details in just 2 weeks as a solo dev. This is so inspiring. I dream to reach your level one day!
nice
Great additions to the first round version that meet all the criteria for this round. This is a really fun game with a solid style and theme. Well done!

Really nice, impressive that you almost made a full game. Only issue I had is that when you jump and move you speed up waaaay faster than on the ground. In level 1 had to go back 2 times because the bomb exploded because of the extra speed.
really impressive entry, you managed to fit the game into the new criteria really well, great additions to an already solid submission, killing it! (insert another bug joke here)

The amount of cutscenes and engaging dialogue in this is super  impressive for a jam game! The "collecting" part felt a bit long,  otherwise the pace was perfect and kept me engaged! This game is absolutely packed with character and charm. Had a great time, only played through story but I may come back to try the other modes later. The animals and the story and the art are just so cute. I had a horrible time during the aim training level as it felt pretty bad to aim but not egregiously so, however my cannons stopped firing and I had to restart the story. I found that even though I was having a horrible time I was also having a great time because of all the charm and cuteness. The story mode alone was incredibly impressive given the time constraints, and great job working in the story and the animals and mostly the projectiles. Well done, very impressive!

I don't know if it's just the cel-shaded art style, but this game reminds me of Wind Waker. Lovely vibe. Cinematics are top notch and just an all round fun game. You did a great job telling the story.

The game looks and sounds great, the story is simple but compelling, the cutscenes are cute and funny. I loved the Katamary when I played them and I love seeing it back here; my favorite part is still the arena battles. I had some trouble in the training when I was supposed to shoot down targets. I assume I need to throw myself at them with some degree of force (I am the projectile?) but I was only able to shoot down one. Other than that, everything else, great work.
Amazing story and cutscene! I like how you implemented the projectile in your round 1 game. Can't wait to see what this game turns into. Great job!
Amazing work this round. Very clear story-telling, cinematic opening was high quality and didn't overstay its welcome. Plenty of story tied into the gameplay. This is S-tier stuff.

Man, the level of polish here is nuts. I'm just blown away by how fantastic the cutscenes have come out, the framing and character animations, it all just looks really polished and juicy, even for a non-jam game. The narrative flows well with your dialog system, it's cute and funny and integrates so seamlessly with the game play. Also just having all the assets in place (Music etc) with a cohesive art style (That cartoon outline depth shader thing look sick). Just a really impressive game.Mechanically the movement feels good, I actually feel like it's a bit more controllable than round 1 but maybe that's just in my head. The shooting is tough!Super awesome job.
The story was so cute! I love the cutscenes. The shooting mechanics were really tough to control to be honest, but everything else about the game is perfect!

I've never seen anyone succeed in expanding on elements of Katamari Damacy like this. Especially with regard to the fidelity and rationality of the story, it is enough to call this game the original Katamari Damacy.
Im happy to see you continued on this game! Very cute opening cutscene and a good expansion on the gameplay of the game!
That was a fun time. Good Job.

Absolutely amazing opening - your storytelling and animation is fantastic!  Also, I love the way you teach us how to play, while still continuing the story.  You actually made a cute dung beetle that I cared about.  The 3d world was amazing. I just wish I was better at moving around it, but the more I played, the better I got.   Overall, seriously impressive world you've created with some of the best animation I've seen!
Get to second area without found a battery )

I think you've started something interesting here with the non-linear world and emergent storytelling. The gameplay doesn't quite gel for me yet but I think with more time this could turn into something cool.

Love the look of this game, especially the robot and its little cat side-kick.  I also like that this was a pretty forgiving platformer.  It was also cool the way you revealed more of the story throughout using the signs.  I think this is the start of something pretty great.  I hope you continue working on it.

Pretty cool game! Is there an ending? I think I went to all the places you can get to but maybe I overlooked something. I reached dead ends on both the left side and right side of the map, and I assume the dead end at the right side is the end as you "leave" the abandoned area. I like that the level design is a bit convoluted, but at the same time you have the battery mechanic which forces you to fully explore an area as you can't go back later without any batteries. Not much of a problem right now (unless I somehow missed the ending) but if you plan to expand on this mechanic it's something to keep in mind.
Very creative and charming

The destructible terrain and the ability for the fox to sniff out buried items was really cool. The handwritten notes scattered around the world were a really nice touch. Just wish there was a bit more gameplay to go with the story, but it doesn't affect the rating.
Loved the game, that is a good doggo!

I liked this a lot!  Using the animal to help look for batteries was a really good use of the theme.  One thing I would recommend is making the animal's role a little more clear from the start, maybe by adding a tiny bit more instruction.  It took a second to understand that "press e to search for batteries" meant having the animal go look, and "nearest battery is too high or too far" had me thinking I had to climb for a while before realizing it just meant the animal couldn't find a path.  Once it clicked I really liked it though, and overall I think the mechanic worked out really well!  Great job!
The pet mechanic was a very cool and inventive implementation of the theme! I also enjoyed the free-form exploration of the different areas in the level

The bomb system is a good addition to your previous game, in my opinion there could be even more digging around.It got me a while to realize the cat is used to search batteries, but that definitely made finding batteries more focused. Nice job with the storytelling too, using letters instead of basic narrative was a good idea.
The story was great and you got the projectile and animal mechanics in there with the bombs and cat. Fun game.
Love the story! I wish the cat did something more than just walk around with me. I couldn't figure out what "Q" was supposed to do. Fun game otherwise!
it's really good, both playably and visually are 10, very good job!

Easy 5 stars for you. This is amazing, great job as always! The only critique i would have is that the screen is a bit to pixelated if played in fullscreen, in my opinion. If I only have the small display, around half my screen size it looks great, but in fullscreen the pixels are a bit too big. Nothing dramatic though, so good job! :)
Amazing work, I loved the different areas, a very fun game to play and unique look to it.

I had the pleasure to test this game while it was still in development and I have to say I'm really impressed with how it turned out in the end! I like how you made the spikes less punishing in this version, it was a really good decision.
Very ambitious, cute and well done!
Veeeery cool game! Super cute art-style! Waiting for full release ;)

I absolutely love your art style.  It is so cool.  Also, the opening images were amazing.  What a great way to begin your story.  UnfortunatelyI'm just terrible at these kind of games, so I wasn't able to get to far into it, but I'm really impressed with what I saw.  Lastly, I thought the music was fantastic too.

The metroidvania elements with the minimap were super good!  I also really loved the art style and the story.  One thing I would recommend is finding ways to make things a little clearer to make sure the low res pixel style isn't getting in the way.  The two places I think were a little hard for me were enemy hits and the spikes.  At first I thought I had missed the enemies when I dashed, so I think just making the hits really extra obvious would help.  Also, it took dying a few times to realize that I was running into spikes.  I know spikes can be hard in a low pixel style cause you can't get the sharp points that scream "this is a spike," but maybe something with the animation again like a blood spurt or having the spikes light up red when  you hit them so that it's really clear what you ran into that made one of your eggs break.  Overall this is a beautiful game and entry and I'd love to see more!
Fun game, I do like metroidvanias. I think you got all the elements needed for the round. The art and style are great and the progression was good. Great work!

Wow. This was a great entry. Simple but effective storytelling. The visual style of the game, with the downscaling and the little wobbles looks great. I may had preferred the opening cutscene to follow the same style. The game feels complete very complete. Minor complain is the very first spikes jump, that was a little frustrating until I realized I could hold down space to âjumpâ further.

Bravo for making a metroidvania and a good one at that too, it's certainly an ambitious thing to do for a game jam. The opening cutscene with that comic book style is done really well and tells the story very clearly. I really like the artwork throughout the game but I think the outline comic artwork is better than the pixel art even though both are absolutely gorgeous by all accounts. I didn't get to explore all of what you created and it's mainly because I am not used to the controls (for me W to jump, space to dash is my norm) and I need to stop to make food so ran out of time. I got 4 health eggs, saw a 5th but couldn't get past the spikes and got the glide ability in the pink area. I enjoyed what I got to see and I appreciate the checkpoints and minimap and at no point did I feel lost. I think marking the nests on the minimap and any powerup that you see but didn't get on there would be a good thing to do if you expand the game. I think it would an improvement if the enemies died in one hit and the general difficulty was lowered at least to begin with. I liked the bees, but I found the bats difficult to defeat and think if they stayed still it would be an easier time and I think an even easier enemy like a snail that crawls around the walls could be cool. I think it was the spikes that I died most on though. There were times when I had a powerup and it said click any button and in my haste to dismiss the prompt I would click my mouse to close the window and end up dashing to my death. There was also a section where I dashed through to the next room and I immediately fell down into spikes as the momentum carried over or maybe it was just me I forget but that section was a tough one to get past but I managed it a number of times and was probably more difficult for me because of jumping, gliding and dashing all at once with controls I'm not familiar with more than anything else. All in all, I think it's a really great game with a lot of great platforming in it, which is exactly the type of game I love and the artwork is stunning and some really great upgrade abilities in there too. Hope my feedback helps in some way. One last suggestion:  I think the dash ability would be more rewarding if it were earned rather than available from the start and if that flower above the spikes wasn't there as I was looking at that instead of the spikes

I find it hard to comment on this game. I'm generally not a big fan of platformers if the movement doesn't "fit" for me. So I didn't get very far in this game. I'm gonna dump my thoughts but they might mean nothing to you as I'm definitely not the target audience for this game :D but I'm doing it anyway because it looks like a lot of thought and effort was put into this game and you stated you want to develop it further.

Its a really nice game and the art, shaders all fits so well. Only issue I had was that it was really hard and the combat didnt give enough feedback imo. It took me very long to realise that the enemies had invunrability frames after getting hit so I just kept dashing and it felt like my hits werent connecting. Also was hard to keep track of my own health since I didnt always see that I got hit. Other then that it fits the criteria perfectly and very impressive that you made it in such a small time
Too good. Can't believe this was done in two weeks. I'm excited for the full release
This has my favorite story so far. Great job on the storyboarding at the beginning, that set the stage perfectly. You built an interesting world. Full marks from me in that category :)

Very well made with good room layout. With this being a story round I'm going into the mindset of finishing all games, but I might regret it if every game takes 35 minutes...The initial dash-jump felt a bit too difficult, was stuck on it for a good minute or two, and accidentally jump right after initial respawn, which made we go into the room above the spawn. Other than that the game felt bug free and polished. The lack of sfx is definitely an issue, but the adaptive music makes up for it, awesome job with that! (I didn't notice it changing dynamically at first, but when I did, I noticed that you even change it depending on the biome, AWESOME!)I heard about the healing issue, I never understood it and wouldn't even known that it was a thing if I hadn't looked at the comments, might be the last room I didn't get tho. This might partly explain why I felt the game was a bit too hard, but I would've had an even better time if it was just a tad easier.The non main character animals (enemies) don't feel that important in terms of them "being animals" since they don't behave much like them anyways. The little peeps on the way were cute though.Overall I really appreciated the game, tho I wish you'd spent more time polishing (sfx) instead of adding more rooms. I know that it's hard making a "tiny" metroidvania I believe a game jam game should never be much longer than 15 minutes as very few people will actually get to the finish and get that satisfaction.Damn that 99% is annoying me more and more while I write this review.Also I think this is the longest game jam game review I've ever written, I guess it's fitting though for such a content packed game.
Such a beautiful game with a really good Metroidvania vibe! Though the game is a little too hard for me, I still enjoyed the gameplay a lot.
This game is (aside from a couple bugs) absolutely perfect!I legit got teary eyed while playing. The visuals and music are just *chefs kiss*
Nice game, but i think the eating seed implementation isn't working for pc people. the bird doesn't eat

I'm not going to lie, I killed a lot of birds (or a lot of birds killed me)  This game was intriguing and I wish I was a little bit better at it.  Still, I liked the flying a lot and thought this was a really solid game and with a bit more story it could be great.
that ending, lol

Took me a bit to figure out the gameplay loop but once I figured it out I actually thought it was pretty creative. I did think the bullets should be able to take out the birds, too, and you should be able to pick up the gems by just moving over them, but I understand if that would make the game too easy.

I like the story at the beginning, very interesting!For the game though, I think it would help if the starting prep area had the UI interactable areas highlighted to more easily indicate what it is the player should be doing at first

It's great to see you continuing with your round one project. I really like how it's progressing and having the birds and then the meteors in space to avoid now is really good. The upgrades to the projectiles are really cool and I made mine super sized. If you were to keep continuing with your project I think it would be really cool if you could teleport the birds when you shoot them and I think when hovering over the upgrade buttons if they were green it would improve it visually. Keep up the great work!
Cool intro.
Cool well thought-out story! Well done my friend!I loved how you collect points with projectiles.

The story was clear and well presented and the teleport bullets were great. I didn't feel like the animals in the game were that crucial. The game is fun and engaging and it was fun reaching the other planet.
This was a fun game! The camera was zoomed a little too close for my liking, making a lot of the dodging obstacles very hard (especially with the speed upgrade). Otherwise, great job!
You really brought me to tears.
its a perfect execution for the tasks great job. I wish overwatch hired you for the jiggle physics

Dang.  I called it pretty much right away on where the story was going but you still almost had me crying when the dog dropped the ball at the end.  Really excellent way to tell a story and you really nailed it with the prompt.  Incredible job!

Watching the puppy grow, I could tell where the story was heading but I couldn't predict how well it would be presented. Seeing the family's grief and the ball in the dog's mouth was very moving and the changes to him as he aged was good too, particularly when he slowed down. D:
I wasn't ready to be this sad ð­
Meanie head. You get 1 star for every tear I cried. Which is zero. Because I didn't even cry at all. 10/10.
10 / 10 cinema. Well done my friend! :D
Great story! I love the tiny details in the storytelling - the NPC looking at the ball, you getting higher, and the dog moving slower as it gets old.
I will never forgive you for the tears you injected into my eyes ;_;
A fantastic game. The story was good and well presented and the mechanics fit the round's theme very well. Well done!
So sad. Well done. ð¥

This is so emotional right from the beginning, the music kinda revealed where it was going but then I started to think about my own previous pets and just cried when throwing the ball one last time. What a soul purifying and destroying experience. You really nailed the storytelling part (and also the other parts), what a genius masterpiece. 5/5 game in every category but I'll never want to play it again.ALSO the way you tell the story via simple gameplay works really well, it reminds me of Edith Finch and some of the minigames there, especially the baby bath and swing ones. Don't know if you've played it but had to mention.

There's not much gameplay but the story is quite touching and it manages to address every part of the criteria decently well. I found the story to be a bit predictable but it was still enjoyable and kept me playing. The customization options were surprisingly robust. Sometimes the dog would run in a circle around the ball instead of picking it up for me which doesn't seem intended but other than that I didn't run into any bugs. Overall, good job!

Thank you! I wasn't quite sure how to handle growing up, because I want players to self-insert themselves into the story for maximum emotional damage. Doing it like this felt like a good way to do it without eating up too much development time, so I'm glad to see that it's appreciated :D
Damn, out here trying to make a grown man cry. Perfect entry for the story round. Well done!
I'm ugly-crying right now. What the hell is wrong with you?
I'm ugly-crying right now. What the hell is wrong with you?
A very moving game. Well done.
Wow!
Impressive, too emotional. You get all the stars from me. :O
I immediately knew where this was going, still played till the end. Good job!

This game, by far, has the best story I've played yet. The art style adds such a pleasant feel, while the audio is just so calming. The only real complaint I have is that I didn't know you can throw the ball until I read the description. Fantastic work!
Amazing work. This is undoubtedly one of my favorite games from this round. The storytelling, the art, the animation, everything comes together so nicely.

You had no business making me this sad :( . This is the type of game I would pay to play. The music, the graphics, the gameplay, the polish - everything. This game is so well made. One of my top 3 in GDKO round 2
This was a really nice game! It made me dreadfully sad but the bit at the end when you get to say goodbye was a nice touch. Wonderful work!
Love the title art and the begin screen, very stylish.

Sorry, I already suffered through one other entry that was a tragic dog story, I find such topic to be in bad taste for a jam game and with currently having a dog I don't want to think about such things. I cannot play this, though looking at screenshots I'm sure you did fine work. Same like with the other game, I will not rate, which is only fair as I did not play it, but thank you for playing and rating mine.
This was such a touching story - we've had to go through grieving for our put a couple of times and it never gets easier. Everything in the game worked very well together!
So sweet TT________TT

I instantly saw this story coming from the first moment as it was nearly exactly the same as my first idea for a game. I think that makes it all the more impressive that I was the most moved by this compared to any other story so far. Being able to play with the dog for a bit and then choose to move on really brought touched me, probably partially due to the loss of my own dog a few years prior ð. I think the projectiles were a little underused as I only really used them in one level and a little bit in another one. The atmosphere was fantastic and I loved talking to the NPCs and the little quest, although it was a small addition it really made the world feel that much more alive. I only had one or two bugs, the first level's elevator didn't go down for me for awhile and I thought there was something I had to do but I just didn't trigger it somehow. Great job but I don't think I can handle anotheroop the dog's deadgame.
Absolutely loved all of this game. No notes from me, really great game!
This game had such a fantastic atmosphere and the narrative aspects were top tier.  Great entry for the story round.
Another fetch game :D

The Narrative component and platforming of this game were really polished, I really liked the vibe/aesthetic you created and the way the themes of loss were handled. The flash like graphics of the characters along with the music gave a really nostalgic feel to the game which sort of drove that even deeper for me, beautiful entry to the jam!
This was great! You definitely took the storytelling prompt and cranked it up to 11. Wish there was more tennis ball mechanics. Definitely the core of the projectile imo.
This was great! You definitely took the storytelling prompt and cranked it up to 11. Wish there was more tennis ball mechanics. Definitely the core of the projectile imo.

The way the story unfolds through the different characters is really good and I like that it's also a personal story for your dog Mako. The bouncy ball as a projectile that also returns is a fun weapon against the creatures.  For feedback, I think the throwing animation could be improved. Seeing the dog at the end and playing fetch with it was a nice way to end your game
10/10 would play fetch with the big doggo again
Did not play the game yet but this thumbnail immediately pulls me in ð
Got goosebumps!
Such an amazing experience. You did a great job on this one, im really glad i played it <3

Amazing game and I love the art. The pacing was a bit slow as in speed of everything, especially with the platforms I would often reach the second one but just not in time and had to wait. Just offsetting the platforms a bit so you can reach them easily in time wouldve helped. Other then that I love the story and the art is just amazing! gj!

The graphics are very pretty. The platforming is simple but effective, with the caveat that in some of the moving platform sections it was all too slow just waiting. Also, I liked how the ball bounced and it was meaningful at the end (no spoilers) and I know I could use it on some enemies (but not others for some reason), but I wish the projectiles had some more use. Also, the prompt was for the animal to be part of the gameplay. You made it part of the story. Still, a great entry.

Simply brilliant!  I think it's my favorite game so far.  Amazing story and storytelling.   The pacing throughout was great for me and it matched the story.   I adored the look of it.  The music was fantastic, as was the ending (sweet and sad).   Also, such a perfect title.  If this isn't in the top ten I will be very unhappy.
Excellent game ! You did a great job telling that story.

I liked it a lot! Well done! :DTho I sometimes got stuck when throwing the dice, if I released to far up, I would click out from the game, when I click on the game again, the dices are stuck and I'm not able to do anything
Very, very cool battles!  Nice touch with literally hitting enemies with the dice.

This is one of my favorite games in the jam.  I love the dice and the multiple ways we can use them for combat.  Lots of cool strategy to work with here.  I liked this a lot and I really hope you get to continue it.

Ok this is a gem. Cool story, neat dice combat mechanic (and I love that the dice physically hurt the enemies lol) overall pretty solid! I did notice that half the level doesn't seem to have any colliders, but it's not a problem since you can just choose to not walk through walls.
Love the art and the writing. Love me some Greek mythology.

This was one of my favourite story driven games in the jam. Loved the general vibe and the writing was very well done. I enjoyed the game mechanics as well, think you've made something you should be very proud of! Great job!
Excellent concept ! The damage on throwing dice is a really cool idea. Very fun, congrats !
Pretty good concept, throwing dice was never this fun!
What a mean rabbit.

Really cool game! The y-sorting and collision didn't seem to be working sadly and I had to restart after trying to roll my dice. I think that the dice as projectiles were really cool and the animal was worked in very well. I think the battle music could have had a slightly longer loop as I found it quite grating after a bit but that's small criticism. Everything worked really well together and I think you did a great job!
I really liked the dice throwing as the projectile mechanic and the story was great and engaging.  I liked the die mechanics as well, they were really fun. Great game!
Dude, well done. I have things that are "wrong" but everything about this is incredible. I can't wait to see what you do in round 3!

I love the story and gameplay. Using rolling dice as projectiles is very creative. There are some slight issues in the world map - the y-sorting isn't working properly and some borders have no collision.

Neat and just my type of game. Itâs a nice expansion on your round 1 game. I get Dicey Dungeon vibes from playing it. Just needs a bit of sounds effects and battle effects to start making the combat feel really good. Great job.

I liked the concept a lot. Using the tongue as the hookshot and shooting flies as the projectile was great and fits the mechanics challenge. I felt like the story was a little light but the game was fun. Well done!
It's a shame that you weren't able to finish this project, I really see the potential for a great game here in the style of UltraKill or Neon White.
I want to see what happens next! This is such a cool concept, and I can't wait to see what happens next!

I like the idea and the ninja frog mechanics - actually, I think this would've done really well during the first round, game mechanics & progression are both well implemented! So I'm happy you managed to publish this even tho you were busy. Okay but a funny story: I noticed that for some reason I acted as I was playing a fps game and tried to reload my gun by pressing R. That of course didn't reload anything but instead I ended up resetting the level multiple times :') I have played too much Marvel Rivals lately, I think.
I can see where you were going for. Unfortunately the controls are very unresponsive. :(
This game reminds me of the flying levels in Cuphead. I think you took the prompt to heart with the story, too. Great job incorporating that.

I'm impressed with how much story and how many characters you created with this.  The flying and shooting is fun, but I do wish it was a little slower and I could see a little further in front of me.  Still, this was a fun game that met all the requirements.
I really like the amount of depth you put into the story!  The intro story and characters were really great!

did you write a novel or make a game? j/k just felt like there was more time spent reading dialogue here then playing the game game play was alright seemed a bit to easy to me though. great aesthetics though  kinda felt like i watching amazing world of gumball.. i honestly started clicking through the story once i figured out how long it was...but im sure it was a good story started good anyways. just adhd really started kicking in about halfway through the 2 cutscene.
I love the aesthetic of the dialogue and the transition to 3D during gameplay. I'm very impressed with the gecko model in particular.

More people should talk about this game. I will make my kids and nephews and nieces  play this if i every have any. Great story, fun game, while the final boss fight was a bit tough for me, I loved this game, probably one of my fav entries.
The story and characters were amazing! You have a real talent for writing engaging dialogue - the shmup sections between dialogue sequences was a great change of pace as well.
Awesome job with the narrative. The character's designs were very good and the shooting sections were fast paced fun. Love the genre mash up. Good job!

Insane attention to detail in the narrative and a quirky cast of characters,  a bit of a bullet hell in the last round which made for some fast pace action, will have to come back and see how it plays out if I choose the differing narrative options! Cool stuff!
Well done making the game and the story!
Interesting take on mixing visual novel with a side scrolling shooter. Fun game.

This was a fun game! I see what you were trying to do with all the different characters, but it made some points of the story confusing. I had to write down everyone's name and role to figure it out. I also wish the plane scenes were zoomed out more. Being that close in made it really hard to dodge enemies. Otherwise, I love the concept, and hope there's a sequel on the horizon!

Absolutely love the opening scene - great animations and voice acting - really awesome.  I even really liked the game play, but it was too hard.  The countdown timer killed me over and over again.  I really wish you had difficulty levels here (which I think would be easy to implement - just change the countdown settings).  Luckily, I was able to skip levels when I got stuck.  I do hope you get to continue this as I would like to play a much easier version again.
Very cool :) I was very bad at this but I think was pretty awesome all the same :)
great story, art was pretty good the controls as unique as they are wasnt the greatest.

The story part of this game was sublime, the art and how everything worked together was perfect. I'll echo some of the other feedback and say that the controls weren't the easiest thing to get to grips with to say the least. I feel like if it was a little easier to control the drone this game could be right up there with the best in the jam!
Amazing opening cutscene. Absolutely cursed gameplay. Glorbo has been avenged. You're next.

An interesting game, it was fun. But why is turn left the button on the right, and turn right the button on the left? Loved the cutscene, but the levels were more about fighting the UI and controls than it was solving puzzles so it wasn't really my thing. Well done game though despite it not being a fit for me.

The cutscenes and voice acting are amazing, the parrot impression is 10/10. But controls... I hate them, just simple WASD would be great, I could not pass the level 2 or 3 where are the first corners appeared, UX is like 0/10
I'm so impressed, by your story and gameplay! How did you manage to make soo many levels! :D

This is a cool concept! I love the mystery and the birb. I think what the issue with difficulty comes down to is that you expect very precise movements with a very imprecise controller. This feels like a cursed issue where you want some imprecise controls to make for interesting gameplay, but then the difficulty of designing interesting levels with that restriction is huge.

Very great cutscene and amazing voice acting! You have so many interesting shots in a short cutscene. The game is still quite difficult, but I'm glad that I can see all the levels even though I had to skip some levels. It's quite impressive to have made so many levels. I really like how you trigger the ending by shooting the projectile.

Just here to drop off a well-deserved full five-star review!  My only complaint is that healing cards took off so much poison that my full poison strategy occasionally meant watching my opponent heal much faster than I could do damage.  Excellent game!

This game was my jam (and honey)!  I loved it!  Seriously, probably my favorite game in the jam so far.  Loved the style (art, sounds, music, story, etc).  It was all so polished.  And the battling was really fun.  I only won 3 of the games, but I still loved it.  I expect this to be in the winner's circle and I want more of it!
Absolutely great game that fits the challenges of the round. Loved the card game mechanics and picking the cards to use in the deck. Good improvements from the last round. Very fun, well done!

I played a few times with different strategies, and each time I discovered new things. I think your game is awesome. The artwork is absolutely stunning and I especially love how the bees come at the end, and the little tail wag from the dog is just adorable. The polished feel and the ability to play against other players setups is totally amazing. This is definitely one of my favourites of the jam
What a masterpiece! I can definitely see myself playing more of this, good job!
Healing meta OP, pls nerf :D managed to snag the first place score on the arcade leaderboards with 117 gold
I died a lot :)
Do bees count as bugs?

People say that the sequel isn't as good. They lied. This was great! Everything I loved about the first game, plus extra mechanics. I also love the idea of taking people's previous builds and facing off against those. I bet some lucky player is excited for an easy victory against my builds lol.
Great work improving your game! It's very polished and fun to play!Tho I was pretty bad at it this time :P
Was great to play on stream and have you there!
I honestly don't what more to say other than... goddamn that's good
The gameplay in this one is incredible. I didn't get to this in the first round. I'm going back to play it again after writing this ð I'll try to get into the top 10.

Already gave a lot of my thoughts so I'll make this brief. Having the hover over the cards was a really cool improvement, especially since it allows you to take a look at others' builds. I feel like healing was a little overpowered or at least just not fun to play or play against personally, I like poison a lot and healing directly countered that which is probably part of the reason I dislike it. I will almost certainly come back and try to top the leaderboards, great job!

An incredible improvement from Round 1! I really enjoyed both the card and upgrade variety. All the visuals are fantastic, the music on point, and the gameplay is enjoyable to watch! I'm not sure how much strategy is involved in card selection, but overall you did great! I hope to see a full version of this game someday.
I am enamored by the visuals of this game!
This game makes me want to try all the synergies. I tried damage build and poison build but both did not get me to the top 10...

Loved the game and story! The UI looks great and the art style is appealing. I feel like there's a slight balance issue. I can't cause significant damage to the enemy even though I'm using a lot of damage cards. So the best thing I can do is pick all shield and healing cards and wait for the bees to kill the enemy.
Thank you for the awesome game, Loten. I loved it. It took me a lot of mental strength to prevent myself from playing it while I was supposed to be working on my own game!

The art is great and the cutscenes are really cute. I am still a little confused with what is going on and most of the time I am just staring without knowing what to do. What is the bottom orange bar? Is that for the bees that come? Why? What are the 3 different numbers in the health bar. What are the 5 boxes under the names at the top? Is honey the gold? What does it mean when a card buffs for âone turnâ? What is âone-turnâ? There are lots of cards may be, some basics about the cards could be added in the game page. Also, I cannot tab-out of the auto-battle as it pauses as soon as the game loses focus. Maybe add an option to speed things up? Also, is it really multiplayer? When I see someoneâs name, is that a deck someone used? Is that someone online right now? Can I chat with them?
Good Job! I only had some enemies, that apparently had the strategy of only choosing healing cards so the bees take out the enemy. Still a great game!
Why are there so many sad dog games in this round?
I loved this game soo much! I don't usually play these types of games, but I loved the gameplay.

I agree with comments below that progression feels a little slow. I wonder if the projectiles are locked behind some upgrade I did not get, but I didnât really see them. How do I increase the quest level? Also, sometimes enemies spawn far away and it takes a while to even run into anyone, maybe add a minimap or some pointer towards where they are?
I just spent waaaayyyy too much time laying this... in a good way :)
Very promising game ! I'm dying too fast, though )))

Great story and images to go with it.  Also, whoever did the voice narration did a awesome job - it sounded fantastic!  As for the actual gameplay, I am so impressed with what you are creating here.  It feels like most of us are creating tiny little games for the jam, but you are at the beginning of something truly epic.  I'm really impressed with what you've packed in already and can't wait to see what you do with it next.

I have to say I REALLY loved the story.  When I saw 4-5 minutes for the intro I was gonna skip immediately but it really dragged me in!  The game is also very good, though I'll agree with some of the other comments that the size of the skill tree is pretty intimidating.  Rating a game jam game it's always hard to feel like there's more game than I have time to experience.  What I did experience is really solid, though!  Good job!

seemed a bit much for a game jam...just feel like if you maybe if you made it shorter with faster progression. that tree im assuming skills tree at the beginning was super intimidating  and the story was to long to watch all the way through which you do warn at the start that it was long. it just feels like you missed the most of the objectives just by over doing not necessarily a bad thing but i cant even judge this game because simply who has the time when there is 60 other games to play..
I wanted to play more, but the progression feels sloooow. Anyway, pretty good gameplay and upgrades!
The updates from last round are all good, but there's still too much for me to be able to make it far in this. I spent about 45 minutes and upgraded a lot but I have to move on.
I really love the premise and the story and would totally want to see this being continued so hers a few issues I had;
The visuals for the intro cutscene are excellent!
Who did the voice acting? Is it AI or did you hire a professional?

Once again, a great game! I wish that you could upgrade things a little faster though. With such a large skill tree, I'd have to play for hours to get any significant upgrades. The story, which was great btw, was a little too long to be right at the beginning imo. I think if you put one scene every time the player returns to the tower, it would both encourage longer play sessions, and make the story more interesting since you're playing through parts of the story.
Well done :) I really enjoyed this.

This is a gorgeous looking game; such an incredible upgrade from the first round.
Small comment, when I was in front of the lever and the drawbridge, the âcageâ was not evident to me. There is some box at the other end of the room and I tried shooting at that, hadnât seen the âother cageâ in the air.

This looks great & the story had my interest. It felt like you were just getting started and I'd love to see more. You've hit the projectile and animal criteria right on. The bow feels wonderful to shoot.

Damn!  That was incredible!  Seriously, I dream of making something that good looking one day.  I couldn't believe how well it played in the web browser too.  Obviously, it still has some work to do: sounds, music, enemy ai.  But, what you have so far is terrific.  This better move on, because I want to play more of it.
Just great! Looking forward for a full game if keep working on this <3

First of all the environment and visuals are AMAZING. The visual style is so clean and pretty and the lighting was done very well too. I think that the requirements were addressed very well, the animal was fun and cute and the projectiles were also useful. I found the story interesting but it led me more to want more of the story rather than feeling like a complete narrative. This is an issue I have with several of the games continued from round 1 just because they weren't built initially with a story in mind. I liked the skill tree from round 1 and was a little bit sad it wasn't present, but I still enjoyed the combat more even if it was just the cooler enemies and fun ragdolls. I may have imagined you saying that there were going to be drop assassinations but I think that would be incredibly cool. I still dropped down on enemies to attack them anyway and that was pretty fun. I wish that the bow was a bit more useful for combat as it felt significantly worse than the dagger even if it just had no knockback. With the daggers knockback you weren't really punished for getting close to enemies anyway so there was no reason to stay far away. Overall, amazing job, hope you continue work. (:

I wish this game had audio :D it's very enjoyable, love the artstyle and while the gameplay is a bit basic at the moment, it has so much potential. But I'm a sucker for first person games like this, so don't listen to my complaints :D  Storytelling was nicely done even without audio. Good stuff!
Very well done! I loved everything about this game. I think you nailed the task and all the required extras, well done!

I still remember your first version of the game and while it was more like an alpha build, this felt like an actual demo. I'm impressed how you managed to build this good-looking and -feeling 3D-game in the given time window. The story was also interesting and dark, the crow is awesome and I kinda want to know more about what had happened.
Was great to play on stream! Thanks for submitting, and sorry for the timezone! Please feel free to watch for comments there (around 02:00:06)
I love the outlines on the 3d models, this game has a very distinct style that i love, great job this feels like am entirely diffrent game than r1

The story and visuals are amazing. I completed the game 2 times to make sure I didn't miss anything. I didn't find a way through the locked doors so I might have done though. I thought the key would have been past the rafters but it wasn't but I liked exploring the levels. It's cool how you can jump on the chandelier, crawl through gaps and use a bow and arrow to shoot skeletons with and that last guy looks incredible!

This is a fine entry that takes on all three of round 2 conditions without holding back on any. It was enjoyable sneaking around and trying to gather pieces of the story. Btw that's some high quality outline shader as far as I can tell (I'm not very knowledgable on shaders) is it or code it is based on available online?
amazing graphics and atmosphere, by far my favorite part. looking forward to future updates if there are any planned. great submission!
I am surprised it is running in my browser :D great job on performance optimizations!
Stone Seeker 2 crow is my new best friend.
Perfect game for me! Especially loved the visuals and the secrets :P

My guys out here making a game with AAA graphics for this game jam. Fighting mechanics really solid (sword and bow), the platforming felt nice as well. I had to really pay attention to the subtitles with the lack of sound but I can understand and see where most of your time went whilst making this submission. Honestly feels like if you fleshed it out you could have something truly special on your hands here. Keep going! I want to see where you take this in the later rounds.

Great game with amazing visuals and an interesting story! I like that the game is a flashback and the ending links back to the start. The battles felt a little dull since you can't take damage at the moment, and the game is a little heavy to run in the browser.

I love crows so damn much. It's always nice to see a 3D Project in a Game Jam. I had a small issue with the bow, it sometime would hit the skeleton and not deal damage. It would've been nice to see the coins and potions end up doing something, but I assume there are plans for Round 3. It's overall a great start the I really look forward too!

Its a solid game. I had some issues with the enemy AI for some reason when I shot them with my bow from a distance they got stuck and wouldnt attack me anymore. same with the boss I could just go behind him and one tap. I like that you free the animal but personally I wouldve liked if the crow was a bit more involved trougout the story.Solid gameplay tho and fun overall good job!
Very fun game! I enjoyed shooting with a bow, though sometimes enemies heads deflect arrows ))))
The environment are really cool, especially the boss room. Good job on bow mechanics !

Visuals are really cool. This remind me of the good old time of rail shooters. Did not fully understood the dialog at the beginning and a bit too much of story at the beginning. But overall very fun idea, curious to see more !
I love rats but not these one! Fun game!

I absolutely love rail shooters.  Once we got into the game, this was really fun.  As others have mentioned, the scroll is too long, but that's an easy fix.  Definitely keep it - it has a cool retro vibe (just tighten it).  Also, I dig the narration, but I did have a little trouble understanding all the words, maybe have a "subtitle" option.  But the main part of the game, the shooting was so much fun and took me back to some of my favorite old games.  One last thing, my images don't look like your included screenshots.  They all felt a little washed out and grey.  I am on an Apple laptop and tried it on Safari and Chrome.   I am attaching an image so you can see what I mean.
Very cool rail shooter
This game looks really nice. I think this could become great with a couple tweaks and Iâd like to see more. A couple comments:

A lot of people have mentioned wanting to move faster through the story but I actually didn't think the scroll was necessary. With the cutscene at the start and a few more clues maybe spread throughout I think it'd be more interesting to piece together the story yourself. I've never played a game of this genre before but I thought it was pretty cool. There wasn't much variety but I think the length was just right and it didn't drag on. I also appreciated the visuals although I think the UI could use some more love. I think the criteria were addressed solidly and that they came together pretty nicely. Overall, well done!
I really enjoyed this. The 'on rails shooter' genre doesn't get enough love. Good Job!
Love the silly one-liners :D

A cool synthwave-supported intro leads us into a game that might have been a doomed side experiment of some legendary director such as Paul Verhoeven that got canned early in development and so it feels like a leaked relic for collector's delight. The shooting is actually fun, and I wouldn't mind if you artificially prolonged it, though giving the ability to replay is nice as well. I get this project was more ambitious than what it might seem so you were pressed for time, still an impressive amount is achieved. While the narrative is presented only in intro, the game has enough traces of it contained within itself (the voiceover and the setting with rats) that it shouldn't be much of a problem.
Loved the story and the sounds.
I think I'm giving this game top marks because everything worked together real smooth and it was bug free for my playthrough. I wish there was more because I really liked the gameplay. Great game!
This fits the prompt to a tee. Reminds me of the House of the Dead :) Awesome entry.

I love this, its not a typical game youd see people make during a gamejam. I would suggest some quality of life changes like being able to scroll faster trough the intro story (its a good story but I rather read and not wait) and the rat dying animation comes a bit too late so at the start i shot 3 bullets whilst only 2 were needed. Other then that it fits the task and its really original keep it up!

As others have said thisreallyreminds me of one of those arcade games with the gun controllers that always got broken. Good thing you can't break this one! I appreciate you giving the ability to quickly replay the level after completing it. It was fun to replay and get 100% accuracy. Can't forget the voice clips that play after every section too! Really added some extra life to the game. Overall extremely impressive game!(Also, rat buddies!!)

I finished the game and loved the inspirations behind it. Your game is a ton of fun. and I really hope you continue development because it's fantastic! Here are a few suggestions to make it even better: The bullet text was a bit cut off and perhaps an image of the six bullets would look nicer.  Being able to adjust the story text scroll speed with the left and right mouse buttons would be great.  Headshots could one-hit kill rats, and maybe add some interactive background elements just for fun when not busy killing rats.  Great job on this one!
Great story with very cool visuals! This type of shooting game gives me a lot of nostalgia. The voiceover in the cutscene is a little bit too muffled and hard to understand.
Really cool! I love the dithering effect, and the PSX style shader on the rats. The voice acting was a nice touch.
The intro scene took a bit too long, the black screen took forever.
The vibes are immaculate in here. Great job! For an on-the-rails-shooter, it was a little easy, but I can only imagine the length of time it takes to set up each scene.  I can't wait for the sequel.
Good job on your first 3d game :) I had fun playing this, wish there was more content, but i fell you. I also didnt have the time to finish everything.
Rare genre you have there! The world needs more rail shooters, I think.

A cool idea! I loved the story at the beginning, but my voice lines once I got to the facility were glitched and kept cutting themselves off. Overall the gameplay and atmosphere were so cool though! Made me feel like I was in an arcade.
Very cute cat sprite and animation. Animation before the jump is adorable!

Adorable story at the beginning with great images.  I like this cat and I want to save this bird, but jumping is really hard and I'm terrible at it.  I kept missing the platforms, falling  down, and having to start all over again.  I wish there was an easy mode.  I would love to see someone better than me play this game, as I would love to see the ending.

I love the art style. The AI narration was a bit jarring for me but other than that I really loved the story slides in the intro and the ending. You did a really great job setting up the relationship between the cat and his bird friend.

I really liked your art and style on this one!  The jump mechanic was a lot of fun but also a little hard to control.  I'd recommend maybe showing more of the trajectory or having the trajectory oscillate instead of just increasing so that you can still make a jump even if you mess up a little at first.  I also think it can be a little risky with the criteria to have a "projectile like jump" and use an animal as the main character, but that's more of GDKO technicality advice for next round.  This was a great game overall though!

First of all, the cat is really cute. The jumping took a bit to get used to and even once I did the aiming felt a bit slow. The story was cute and I can't help but notice that our good/evil bird designs look incredibly similar. Great minds think alike I guess. I found the difficulty to be a bit hard, and combined with the fact that there are no changes to the map or indicator of how high you are I had to stop playing. I may come back to finish this to get the full experience but I'd like to rate as many games as possible so I don't have the time for that at the moment. Bouncing off of walls was kind of annoying but I grew to like it, however I feel like it may have been a bit much and the incredibly high amount of sliding you do after bouncing off a wall versus landing squarely otherwise felt a bit unintuitive. The intro at the start was very cute and a good way of communicating the story although the voicelines felt a bit dissonant with the tone of the game. Overall, I enjoyed playing it, well done!
The jumping was interesting and took me some time to get used to. Fun game.
Very jump king energy. I liked it! Well done
Love the opening intro! Though I think it would be better without the voice to go with it. Its a bit dissonant with the tone of the cutscene and the other sounds/visuals.
Awesome cinematic intro, got me invested! Well done!
The cat's sprite is so ungodly cute. The movement felt a bit rough around the edges, but regardless the art is so good I don't even care.
Very fun but tricky game. Good Job.
â ï¸Please refresh the page once if an error message appears on the first playâ ï¸

This was a good entry!  Solid little game, and you did a good job adding in the elements for the round. One tweak I'd recommend would be to slow down the fire rate for the stun gun a bit, since if you got hit once it was really easy to get stuck for a long time.  One other thing I'd recommend just for rating purposes is to have the projectiles and animal show up earlier in the game.  In a jam like this there's always a chance that someone isn't good enough at your game to reach the boss fight, so someone could get partway through and think "I didn't see any animals" and dock you points.  Great game overall though!

The game itself was really good, the platforming mechanics were awesome and it felt awesome to play. Got into a real flow state jumping up the map and you nailed the main game loop. I didn't come across any bugs during my playthrough. You had a story and you added in a cool animal boss fight at the end. No real criticism other than some of the sounds were a little loud for headphone users, you could maybe look at tweaking them and making sure the main game music is at the same level of loudness as the boss fight, it made me jump! Overall you did a great job. Well done!

This was one of my fav entries from round 1. But I am not sure if it very well aligned with the criterias as much as I would have wanted it to be especially with the projectile, although it is somewhat aligned. And yes this game is free from bugs (at least I did not come across any). Escaping the lava was fun !
Good additions to the game from the last round. I appreciate the space to jump as well as the w. Fun game with a story. The projectiles and animal were all there, good work!

Love to see this project working its way through the ranks! I appreciated the ability to read through the story elements at my own pace. The platforming has come a long way since last round as well! Can't wait to see what's next for you.
That was a fun. I think you've a got in interesting idea overall.
The platforming feels good, but I'm getting a lot of lag hitches when playing it in my browser that makes me miss some jumps.

Ah, I remember playing this in the first round. What a fantastic improvement! I absolutely adore the extended game loop of managing your moveable platform, whilst trying to outrun the rising lava. The enemies didn't add all that much, but the boss fight at the end was fairly fun! I understand why you made a big text wall, considering I did almost the same thing, but it's still makes the story feel rushed. You did fantastic!

This was fun. The platforming felt good although I never really felt like the lava was a threat. The story felt a bit shoved into the game as it was just a lot of text at the start which I decided to skip halfway through. I'm assuming the boss was the animal but there was nothing really 'animal' about it. I also didn't really like the boss because it didn't really align with the games mechanics, like the platforming, and it took me two minutes to realize I had to touch it to deal damage as touching enemies is actively discourage in the game. Overall, it was an enjoyable experience, well done.
Fun game but I couldnt play more because it crashes my browser HARD in less than a minute. A bit more from a fresh boot, but it eventually crashes. unfortunately. Anyone else with this problem?
pretty cool platforming, i think you should focus more on visuals but thats a nitpick, also it doesnt effect the round criteria

The platforming were already good during they first round but I feel like the threat of lava really added something to it. At first I thought lava was rising too slowly and didn't really care about it, but at the end I failed a little and was panicking that it would get me. I also like your character art.
The platforming feels great. I made it all the way to the end ð
First, I love to see other C3 Programmers in the Jam!
This was a fun platformer! I wish it didn't lag so much so that I could finish the story. Once I got to level 4, I couldn't continue because of the lag.
