I loved trying to save my dog here, but is it possible to actually save the dog.  I tried a few times, but always died in the end.  Also, I'm not sure what the icons in the corner do.  I clicked on them, but nothing happened.  If you get a chance, add a tutorial to this game - it would help us get more out of it.  I hope you continue to work on it.  Well done.

I'd agree with some of the other comments here that a little could go a long way for this one!  Even if you don't have time to put a tutorial in the game itself, some notes in the description of "this is what to expect and how to play" can really go a long way. I really like your game, it also just takes a bit to figure out what's going on and how to play.

decently fun game to play.  not for sure the point of the dog other than to say you put an animal in your game. the was no narrative that i came across in the five mins of play. couldn't find instructions on how to play therefore i couldn't figure out what the symbols on the bottom screen was for...maybe a bit of a story to explain why stars are chasing after me and the ghost dog. honestly thought that maybe the dog would heal me if stand next it but it didnt
An interesting game for sure! Highlight was blasting stars with my ghost doggo while techno blared in the background!

I didn't fully understand how to play, but the inclusion of a manual was a creative and fun addition! I feel like I would understand the building mechanics a lot better if I had more time to experiment with them.
I tried but I had no idea what's going on. Definitely needs some kind of tutorial.

I was a little overwhelmed to begin with, but once I got the hang of things better I started to really enjoy this one. The art style was really cute, and having my poor ghost pooch follow me around was enough to show me the narrative. The game over screen in particular was very well done, epic effect. Good job (:

I remember this game from the first round, and I thought I got the hang of it then, but this time around I feel very lost even after reading everything and trying a lot of different things. I reloaded it a few times, but I was not making any progress. Might come back after I'm done playing and rating the rest. Good work, there's a lot in here, might just need some better tutorials and building descriptions.

I'll be honest, I don't think I'm the intended audience for this game. I can't understand what's going on, even after reading the pdf. I think a more hands on tutorial is needed for this game. As it is, I'm going to try to rate fairly, but I honestly can't tell what the game is about.

Cool concept, very unique. I think the addition, that the enemy attack is an actual minigame, which influences the game is great. The visuals are something you need to work on, because the pixel density is not the same on the whole screen, this looks a bit weird. Some pixels are bigger than others, and then there are circles which arent pixelated at all. Make it consistent everywhere and it'll look better with not much effort. Still a great entry, good job!
A very unique game, I liked the story you added to the game. Very interesting!
Very cool and very unique game !

Its a cool game with a lot of features so good job on that. I found it a bit hard with the dodging (little tip here make the hitboxes a bit forgiving, I went up and my back touched a spike that already passed barely so I got hit. Adjusting the hitboxes might seem unfair but will feel more fair. Some sprites were missing the wizard (i think) was just a bunch of flags?I do like all the ideas youve made it makes me think of undertale so it could become a real cool game and I would definitly play more of this!

i personally had a hard time dodging the projectiles do to not being able to tell if they were at the top or the bottom and couldn't make it pass the first mission. probably on me though i do enjoy a good d&d game but only coop with my buddies. not for sure if there was an animal in the game at all maybe i didn't far enough sure it had a solid story being that type of game it is. really has potential though..

I love D&D and I think my experience with that game really helped here (as there were a lot of concepts to learn).  I also love turn based games, so I did enjoy this.  And, while it might have been inspired by D&D,  I also thought it was very original with things like dodging the projectiles.  You managed to pack a lot in here for a game jam.  My one suggestion would be a slightly easier and more intuitive beginning and tutorial.  But, even without, I enjoyed this a lot.  Really well done and impressive.

Interesting premise! A bit too slow for me to enjoy but I can definitely see the appeal. I like that there are choices for party composition and loot but I didn't really notice anything special happening with them. They just do their thing but it's hard to see what that thing is, or why it's good/bad. Also, I didn't expect that failing the minigame would wipe the whole party immediately, I wrongly assumed it only influenced spell effectiveness and I didn't care for a 2hp heal but it killed me :')
I love games that add new unique feature to turn-base so I was completly hokked on the gameplay. The familiar is aslo really clever for the animal.
I am pretty bad at this game! hahaha but was very fun
This is a lot of fun. I like the combat system and everything was done so well. An improvement on the round one game. I think you hit all the marks for the round, well done!

You got lucky since your 1. round game already had very interesting and well-build projectile mechanics :D Nice to see you still decided to develop the game more and didn't just publish the same build twice.

At first I thought "oh cool, this is dnd inspired." Then I realized "oh wow. This is dnd and undertale inspired". Love the concept!  I think the power scaling could be reduced a bit. I think 50 health for 1 enemy is probably good, but when 3 enemies have 50 health and my whole team combined has 30, it feels like I'm at a disadvantage. Even with a disadvantage, that's fine, but I felt like I wanted more ways to solve that problem than "reroll stats"

I played this previously too. I still like the idea. I would have liked to have the story told differently. Currently it is a bit of a lore dumb. Maybe some bits between fights.I find the dodging phase a bit to easy. Especially when you repeat the same actions multiple times. I would like to see more randomness.
Great work. I love the new additions for this round! Any plans to continue further?
Did you forget to enable 'play in browser'? (Asking since your last round entry had browser support)
Looooved the story )
I enjoyed this so much. Full marks :)

Love the opening scene - that book animation was awesome and so was the story.  Honestly, this game was so much fun.  I loved it.  I did enjoy the egg shooting more than the rocket propulsion, but both still made for some clever and challenging puzzles.  Really awesome game.  Definitely, one of my favorites.
Excellent story <3 gameplay is pretty fun too. Sad to see that you ran out of time, there's definitely room for more :D
This is a really sweet story. I love the art style and the writing in the cutscenes. You really played with our feelings there. I wasn't sure whether to laugh or cry by the end of each cutscene.

It was good to see how much you had worked on this from round 1 to round 2, it's coming along nicely. The first level I felt was pretty much perfect, just the right level of difficulty.  The second level felt a bit more unfair, mainly because of how far back the spawn point takes you, it takes a little while to get back into the action and it feels a bit discouraging because once you know how to navigate those first obstacles it becomes more of a chore than fun. The story elements were done very well and overall an impressive and enjoyable game. Great job!
Tried this with my 6 yo grandkid. Level 1 was perfect. Level 2 we got stuck on trying to get to the first duckling...
A cure creative game that was fun. Surprisingly not the only "birds as projectiles" game in the round. Good work!
What a cute game! I was a little confused why the ducklings couldn't launch through things when I could. It took me a long time to realize the intended solution to return to the nest on level 2.
Now the controls are excellent! Good job!
I played this in the first round and it's great to see how much more you've managed to add into the game since then. You stuck to the tasks criteria and created something fun. Great job!

Very well done. The story was heartfelt and enjoyable and the book was a nice touch. I wish the text showed up a bit faster or there was an option to skip the animation, I almost skipped the story because I get easily annoyed by slow text (but I'm very glad I stuck with it.) The mechanics were really fun and I had a great time playing. You mention not having time to finish the final level at the end but I wish you hadn't, I felt like I had just had a full experience and that just made me consider what was missing rather than enjoying what was there. Overall, very well done, great evolution from round 1.
WOAH this is so much more polished than r1 loved it good job!

The storytelling in the book was excellent. I enjoyed the challenge of getting all the ducklings to the nest and I made it to the turbo rocket level. While I found it a bit frustrating to be sent all the way back to the nest after touching certain objects, the movement itself felt great
What a heartwarming and funny story! I really like the pool table-like projectiles mechanic. The rocket mechanics are also pretty fun.

Ohhh my goodness!This has to be my favorite evolution of game concept from Round 1 to 2!!!This story had me sooooo emotional, and thats not even mentioning the great mechanics this time round. Terrific job
Had a great time throwing my ducks around! very nice touch with the book to tell the story. great job

A cute and silly game. You covered all of the criteria well. Minor nitpick is that I wish the text moved a little faster. I would not mind seeing more of this game in future rounds, felt like it was just getting started and Iâm wondering what kind of puzzles/levels you had in mind. Great job.

Good atmosphere and an interesting narrative.  Got a bit bored looking for the flowers, it took a really long time. Other than that, the monster popping up from time to time was great and the game was bug free for me. Well done!

It was pretty hard to find those flowers in the dark, maybe scattering them more would help the pacing, unless it was intentional...By the way, never found any monsters, I was prepared for a jump scare haha

I love horror games and was impressed with how well you created an atmosphere. The story was intriguing and good job on the voice acting. The flowers were very difficult to find but that only added to my sense of dread for when the monster eventually got me. The environment was spooky and I think overall you did a very good job. As someone mentioned in the comments below the only real criticism I have was trying to find those damned flowers, I think if you find a way to make them easier to find, you will keep the player more engaged for longer. I think it probably was a design choice on your part to force the player to search them out whilst being worried about the monster, I just think it needs tweaking somehow. Well done!

This is a cool concept! I think the issue with the lighting make the game almost unplayable. It would really benefit the game a lot if the flowers you're looking for (which are tiny and blend into the environment too much) had a dim light around them to make it easier to see. Same thing with the enemy. It blends in so much that I couldn't see it to shoot until it was too late.

The first time I played this, I accidentally press shoot instantly after the game begun and ended up shooting the dog :') For a while I was all like, "OH NO I'M THE MURDERER", but after I restarted I realized it was just me spamming the left mouse button a little too aggressively.

I sadly did not finish it. I forced myself to get the first 3 flowers (the last one I accidentally got while moving from the monster), but when I found out there was more aimless searching to be done I gave up.I liked the intro and the voice acting adds character, but I didn't feel that the fact Maverick was an animal influenced the story, Maverick could've just as well been your grandpa and the story (from what I've seen) would've still worked.
Nice work making a 3D game!
I really liked it!
A couple minor bugs aside, this was REALLY something special.  Story, music, gameplay, etc... all really flowed well together!  Great job!!
Today I learned that cows are jerks and will steal your spaceship the first chance they get.
I think the intro cutscene was great at setting the stage. You have a great sense for what you need to show for effective storytelling & strong pixel art. That cow butt caught me by surprise ð
Nice cow! :D

Absolutely love the opening cut scene.  Great storytelling without words.  The image of the cow jamming itself into the UFO was hysterical.   As for the actual game, I love puzzle games like this, even if I'm terrible at them (not your fault).  I hope you get to continue working on it.
Really fun and addicting, given some more time and polish, this could easily be one of my favorite puzzle games. Well done!

Well done! This game was super addictive despite the lose conditions being a bit bugged. It was okay because the game was super addictive and I wanted to keep playing anyway. But yea, great work with the super original gameplay and the funny story. I had a lot of fun.

This was my first time trying this game, and I really enjoyed your unique take on the block puzzle game. Even as a prototype the mechanics and presentation are so polished! I had some difficulty adjusting to the controls but that became easier the more I played. Would love to see where this goes!

The cutscene was excellent, really well done there! The block eating/spitting mechanic was a lot of fun, and it was cool how many blocks you could eat. I instantly knew how to play the game and the visuals were great. I appreciate the ambition of the 4-directional eating ability, and it's technically impressive. However, it made the game feel more complex, and I encountered some out-of-bounds problems with overlapping blocks.  I wonder if a 2-directional system would be better in some ways perhaps

The intro is really cute and the platforming was very fun. The visuals and pixelart are incredibly charming and fun. I think that the feedback for blocks being destroyed could have been a little bit faster and also generally spent a lot of time kind of confused. I wish there was a better way to get out of being buried. The mechanics and ideas are really interesting. Not exactly sure what the projectiles are, maybe spitting out the blocks but they didn't really behave that way. I think the story was cute and the animal was a great addition. There were definitely a multitude of bugs, not enough to make it unplayable but I experienced a lot of stuff clipping out of the map and vibrating blocks. The game was still playable and fun, though, and I love how original the mechanics are. I think having W and up arrow be options for jumping would have been nice too, as directional inputs were already being provided and I would rather use that than another key to remember in addition. Overall, the game was very polished and cute, well done!
I'm glad that you get a wild card in the first round!

I really like the visual aspect of this game! The cutscene at the start, the animations of the gameplay, and just every bit of art looks great! The music was really loud on launch, but It was easily fixable in the settings. The game loop is super fun! I'd love to see different difficulty options, along side a ramping difficulty curve as the game goes on. Great work!

Love the concept! I found a few bugs, most notably you can shoot a block through another block to clip the edge of the level. I would also love A better way to un-dig myself from being buried. Maybe if I could eat and swallow a block instead of having to shoot it? idk, but super fun vibes!
W cutscenelove the gameplaygreat work man!
The intro is great and some aspects from the round 1 submission are more polished now. I wish you will be able to add dying at some point so this can really become an intense survival minigame.
Cute start intro, very nice art!

Very cool cutscene. Great art. I liked the round 1 submission and I was looking forward to seeing how it would evolve. I did run into a couple bugs, one is that I was spitting blocks but those were going stacking or somemthing and didnât do anything. I also got trapped between blocks and couldnât eat nor get out. I think the speed is a little too fast, maybe introduce the game at a lower speed first.
Very nice graphics and colors. Liked the simple sounds and gameplay.
Cute scarecrow! Very neat game )

I love crows so much. The game could definitely use more enemy variation and later in the game I'd just get hit by an enemy before I could see there was an enemy on screen, but it was a minor issue. The ability to increase crit chance and crit damage is something you don't see that often in Jams, but incredibly welcome. Although, no amount of gameplay can extinguish my joy upon seeing crows.

Dude you really nailed this one!  From the title to the intro art and story, to the gameplay being fun enough that I kept playing well past the point of knowing how I'd rate it, that's a full five stars from me!
Very neat :)

I loved this game! First, you have my favorite game title (I love that a bunch of crows are called a murder).  Second, I really dug the opening cut scene.  Third, and most importantly, it was just really fun to play. I love the mechanics of it (shooting out my crows) and the upgrades were awesome (I really looked forward to those).  If I'm being nit-picky, I think there could have been a little more story, but I still loved it as is.  And, for a brief moment (I assume), I made it to 10th on the leader board - I was very proud.  This is a winner and I really hope you get to continue it and I can play it again!
The game mechanics were there for the challenge of the round. I would have enjoyed a more finished game, but that's not what we're judging here. It was addicting and fun, well done!
Using the mouse, the arrow keys/WASD and space at the same time is kinda awkward. maybe better to auto shoot or auto aim so you either do not have to use the space bar or the mouse.
This was great! I would have loved an alternative to the spacebar, since the main strategy is just hold space and dodge. Otherwise, the theme, the upgrades. Everything was great!
Pretty enjoyable game! The story feels a bit weak but it helps setting the mood. Gameplay was fun, except for the holding down spacebar part :')
Pretty fun! I wish I could play more but holding spacebar all the time makes my wrist hurt :(
This is my favorite submission of yours so far! It had a really fun gameplay loop, and I loved all the upgrades, especially crow storm and the homing upgrade.
Feels likes Vampire Survivors! I liked this one. Kept my brain engaged the whole time. You could expand this in a lot of fun ways. You've got the animal and projectile down perfectly.

I had a lot of fun with this game! I think having shoot bound to the mouse would have been better. I initially assumed there were only stat buff upgrades from the first few I was offered but was pleasantly surprised when I discovered the variety available.  Combining the projectiles with the animals was a sneaky devious move that in my opinion definitely made the whole game more cohesive. I wish the enemies had a bit more contrast with the ground as generally for me when playing video games (and this is ameproblem) I tunnel vision into very specific things. This meant that while chasing one enemy I just wouldn't process the other one or multiple heading towards me, and I think if their color had been a bit brighter and if the grass didn't render on top of them that might have resolved the issue. This was a ton of fun, and I'll probably come back to this later to attempt to get a better score. Well done!

I found it frustrating that the space bar was the shoot button, and it made me bind it to my mouse instead ð. I really enjoyed the upgrade system with its many great options. It feels like you have the bare bones of something great here, and I can tell the game wants to be something more, but it seems like you just didn't have enough time. For what it is, I really enjoyed playing it, and I would love to see this continued in a future round.
Simple, yet fun and addictive!The intro cutscene is also really great!

It felt like a GBC game from back in the day. I'm not overly great at games like this but can see how you could get addicted to the game loop very quickly. Sound was awesome. Didn't encounter any bugs and the story was clear from the outset. I liked how you killed two crows (sorry) with one stone with regards to this rounds task, combining both the projectile and animal into one. Cool game. Well done!

Great cutscene! I've already played your game three times already and keep improving my score, will definitely come back for more.  The upgrade system is a fantastic addition, especially the homing crow and the options you give made me experiment with a few different strategies. Two suggestions, mouse button for shooting would feel more intuitive to me and I can tell you had a plan for a character for the green squares but for me personally the green blends too much with the background
this is the top! I have nothing to complain about. I was enjoying playing this game, it is hyper addictive!
Very cool game, it was fun but very difficult!
VERY fun and very challenging!
This was a REALLY good entry.  Your level design did an excellent job of teaching the mechanics over time, too.  Great job!
That was fun.

Challenging but fun game! The projectile mechanics worked very well and I think you introduced the new ways to use it in a good way. The only thing I didn't understand at first was the instant reload powerup, I had no idea what it was supposed to do for a while, I assumed it would spin me or something but I couldn't get that to work before I realized it was a reload.

I loved that opening with the nut getting stolen.  It made me instantly sympathize with the elephant (who I loved) and wanted to get it back.  Cool projectile mechanic.  I was just really terrible at this game.  It was definitely one of the hardest to play for me.  I don't know why, but there is something about that jump and shoot down mechanic that was just tricky for me.  I'm glad you included the full run video, so I could see what a talented player could do.  Overall, well polished and challenging platformer (that met all the requirements) and I wish you the best with it.

A REALLY polished and well thought out platformer. My only real complaint is the Boss Fight, but that might be more of a me problem, as I can't put into words why I didn't care for it. I also wish you could kill more of the enemies. The birds being the only killable enemy made some levels feel less interesting than the could've been. Regardless,  the art is so fun to look at, and the audio is really nice! The only feedback I can give is to have a better icon for the game itself lol.

Really liked this game. I fell off the map on one level and I have to move on because I don't want to play through them again at the moment. That doesn't really affect my rating, just a bummer for me. You got a good story, good projectiles, and animals. The puzzles are fun and challenging. Great work! I'll try to get back to finish game.
Really cool intro and in general the vibe is fun and light!
my reflex is bad glad you included the video. Reminded me of a game called Dave I used to play. Loved it. You even had a boss fight. Great work!
I won!
Damn this is definitely one of my favorites from the jam so far. Great storytelling, great projectile mechanic, fun platforming, animals, great work!

Rage inducing yet still fun. I think the difficulty was a bit high, and I also felt like the levels felt a bit all over the place in terms of difficulty without a clear curve. There were a few points when you could leave the map and the controls were a bit finnicky. I liked the shader and the simple art style. Overall, well done!

I CRIEDwhen they stole my,MY NUT, REALLY COOL PLATFORMER LOVED THE SIMPLE ONE ROOM CONCEPT!im still angry they stole my nut... got to the boss but couldnt beat it so idk if theres a super plotwist in the ending cutscene or not sorry

Love it so far, the tusk aim is brilliant example of shaping the game by your character concept, and it was ecstatic to finally figure out how to solve that level with 2x2 turrets lined up in the middle (actually that was the most challenging level yet even though it appears early on, and I only got the clue by accident). However in the first level with legionnaire squirrels I went through the wall and there was no reset, kind of a bummer as it takes a while to get to that point, I'll prob retry later when I have more time. Real good work.
Stellar gameplay! The mechanics are so simple yet so meticulous, and all the levels are extremely clever!

This game is awesome and I've just spent the last 30 minutes trying to beat it but I had to give up before I throw my keyboard at the screen. Loved the NES style graphics and animations and as a whole this makes for a really fun experience. The level design was great. My one and only criticism of this game is the damn control scheme (I'm not a PC gamer, I normally play with controller so this is probably part of the problem). Other than that, which is probably a skill issue, this game was 5*. Oh and that chiptune in the background is absolutely funky as hell and I'm all for it. Awesome job dude!
Great game, I love the art style and the multi-purpose design of the projectile mechanic!
Love it. I'm addicted. I'm coming for you danny...
cool! it's addictive! :O
Very fun puzzle platformer. Great progress after first round!

I was intrigued by this game.  Unfortunately, I ran into a few bugs that locked it up and kept me from moving on.  I think you have the start of something promising here and I hope you keep working on it, bringing it to life, and squashing those pesky bugs.
the camera is wonky, the textboxes are too small, but it fits most of the judging criteria. Interesting!
This was a tough game for me to play. Note: do not press the space key before the game starts or else it will crash.
Good job making the story and the gameplay! :D
I like the starting cutscene, a joyful asteroid disco. And this is still a charming game, I was honestly glad when I heard you got to continue to round 2!

I gotta be honest, this game was tough to play. The camera jumping around, the reset ruining any progress you made because of 1 mistake... It's really tough. That said, the story was fun and interesting! The puzzles were well designed, even if unforgiving. I think you have a lot of potential here!
Love the opening animation and especially the animation when you get the Cat Gun 3000 - so cool!
I could not move anymore after the cutscene where I gave clothing to the (old) man. After restarting the game that did not happen anymore, so maybe some control buffering issue going on.
Really neat idea and the art was top notch! Good job!
No idea what I did or why I did it, but I reached the credits :D
Always love your games. I think you got all the points of the round, got an engaging story, projectiles, and some kitty bullets. Great art as always. Great game.
Superstrange - I stuck on second stage, character stop moving :(

I say this to every one of your games but the art is gorgeous. The mechanics to be honest made... no sense to me? I won though. I don't know what I was supposed to do with the shapes and numbers but I shot the yarn and made the guy happy. Side note but the art for the yarn looks so fun and soft. The cats serving as projectiles was an interesting but cute choice, and the story was incredibly simple but did serve to bring a purpose to playing the game. Overall, cute game and nicely done!
Warm kitty soft kitty

I love the projectile mechanics a lot, very interesting way to implement different kind of ammos. I would like to see this developed  further, like more puzzles (or even a math game!) (I like math games you see). Also, the story is really sweet and your artstyle is cuteee ~~
The one word  I think describes this game best is "CUTEEE!" Well done! Brought a smile to my face after so many sad story games.
WOAH! The art, the animation, everything here is so polished! The game came out swinging and made a REALLY strong first impression with the graphics.

Great game with a fun story! The art style in this game is amazing. Using a cat as a projectile is very creative. I feel the number system for different colors of yarn balls isn't very intuitive. I think you could just have different colored cats or guns to let players switch between.
loved getting that old man his blue yarn hahaha, art was a stand out here for sure! good stuff

I like that you answered the judging questions on your description page. I managed to complete the game and keep the guy warm without getting hit once :) Using the cats as projectiles on the yarn balls was good fun and I like how they get smaller. It reminds me of a game called pang.  Changing the numbers for each colour is a great idea and if you were to expand on the game I think having multiple colours at once could make for a good challenge
Such a nice looking game, I really love these visuals!I love the little animation when you pick up the gun :D reminded me of enter the gungeon.Well done!
Interesting game, almost anti-tower defense! Great tutorial/starting screen, teaching while playing. And a cute turtle!

A wild improvement from Round 1! The first game was already a super cool concept with a great execution, but now you've really made an awesome game. The music adds a nice touch, although the SFX gets a little annoying in the later levels.  The turret variations are all really fun and force you to approach each obstacle slightly different. Fantastic work!
I enjoyed this a lot.

This game was kind of tough, but I had fun with it. Once the animals started staggering over the course of the track I knew I was in trouble. My elephant would always go down :< Well thought out projectile mechanics & crucial animals, check.
Was not expecting a Reverse-tower-defense game, very cool! With more polishing it could be a great experience!
Nice twist on tower defense style. I liked the story and cute design. Instant kill of animals is a bit harsh especially with the slow movement. Really curious to see this concept evolved !
This was like an inverted tower defense game, I really like the concept and the shield system! The artstyle was also very appealing.

Really cool storytelling and I love the reverse-tower-defense style gameplay. I hope you continue to work on it because there's definitely something there! I just wish the animals had lives because it's pretty punishing as it is.

Pretty fun and unique gameplay mechanic! I did constantly spam dash to speed up my bros and to speed up the slower ones if they fall behind. Once the animals are stacked it's easier to manage them, but even then one small mistake can end a run instantly. It did start to get repetitive rather quickly, there was some variety in enemy turret patterns but other than that it felt very samey.

Really interesting idea that I'm surprised I haven't seen done before. I thought it was really cool although maybe a bit slow/repetitive for my taste. I think that the difficulty was kind of weird as for any given level it would just be hardest at the points were you are closest to a turret, it might be better to have it slowly increase. The art was cute and the difficulty levels were a nice addition. The projectiles and animals worked together very well but I do wish the story had been integrated a bit further. Overall, nicely done!
Fun art! Fun story! Reminded me of the old flash games i used to play after coming back from school

I'd call this game a success, it has original mechanics born out of round 2 limitations, many levels, cute graphics. It got more fun once I loosened up and discovered that I could walk anywhere on the map not just along the path. Well done.
Great game! Good story with all the required mechanics done in a very fun and creative way. Well done!
Was great to play on stream! Please feel free to watch comments there (00:00:00 mark I start with yours) Thanks for submitting!
I managed to save four animals on hard mode and made it to the elephant! I'm not sure if the leaderboard updated the new score but this game is excellent and I love everything about it
Fun game again, hope to see you in round 3 :)

It always amazes me how other people are able to churn out almost a complete game in a couple of weeks! The art style was gorgeous, great sound. Loved the little backstory at the start with the accompanying visuals. Master Splinter would be proud.
This is so cool! You made such good progress since last time I played this! I'm so impressed! :D
I want to echo MessMess comment. I played on easy and still couldnât get Donatello over to the finish line. Maybe include a âvery easyâ for next round!
I loved this game!
Really like the story, keeps you real intrigued!The sound aspect could do with some work though, a lot of the unexpected contact sound effects and constant static was kinda disorienting.
Super satisfying physics gameplay. The sound effects really bring it all together for me.
I enjoyed it but no matter what I couldn't escape..

I love golf games and this was really fun.  I'm not sure why, but on my Apple laptop (both in Safari and Chrome) the game would only fill up 1/4 of the screen (even if I zoomed in).  It was still playable though and a fun challenge.  I love when the golf ball started to have it's own identity and thoughts.  Really clever and original.  I hope you get to continue this.

This was a really cool game. Making the game become meta and break down was an interesting choice that left me unsure if some of the bugs I experienced were intentional? I couldn't fullscreen which I assume was unintentional, although it *SPOILERS* caused me to try and refresh the game to see if it would fix the issue after I couldn't figure out how to escape. I wanted to try and read some text I couldn't see when it was small but then I realized what it meant by the true start of the game and proceeded directly off. I don't know if the audio was supposed to break down into buzzing a few minutes into my playthrough but that was unpleasant. I really liked the simple visuals and the shader for the clues or whatever looked incredibly cool. I was actually having a lot of fun even with just the mini golf. I didn't see any animals but I'm assuming I just missed them. Maybe a video of a whole actual playthrough would be nice to tell which bugs may or may not be intentional and how the game is actually meant to end. I still had a great time and think that it did a great job with some criteria just not others. Nicely done!
Really liked the minigolf mixed with the existential dread of the golf ball. Really fun game.

This is, so far, my second favorite game in the entirety of Round 2! I love golfing games, and creepy imagery, so this game couldn't be more perfect! The controls were a little hard to use at first, but after I got the hand of it, I did another 5ish runs. My best run was 8 total shots! It's hard to say anything other than, THIS IS AN AWSOME GAME.
I always enjoy a good mini golf game :) Well done.
Very good, I cant escape though :(

Nice game with a great creepy vibe! I keep getting surprised. I still can't find the way out - I found the hidden path and thought that was it, but I still get reset after falling off the mini golf track. Maybe add more hints for how to progress the story.

Interesting! A kind of analog horror twist on golf is a super cool idea and the narrative components with the dialog and the cool effects and hidden messages is a great vibe. I freed the blue guy, but I wasn't sure exactly how to get to the next stage of the story, do I just need to hit a low enough score?Really cool idea, I love golf games, I love the verticality of the level, and I love creepy story stuff. its like half minigolf and half marble run half horror game. I think there is something super special in that concept.Great job!
I only managed 13. Loved the creepy plot twist and the rewind shot ability was cool. A couple audio bugs but other than a fun game. Nice work!
I got 12 ð I love golf games, this was great. I liked how precisely you can hit the ball. I think golf fits 'projectile' perfectly and you had the animal narrator with the surprise twist.
I was worried that there wouldn't be a story, until I got to the end. I got legitimate chills. Great job! I hope you figure out that issue with the window. I'd love to play a fullscreen version!
A cute game! I liked it!

This was really good!  I liked the story and mechanics.  One nitpicky thing is that  throwing the bone onto the switch meant the dog hit the bone and stopped before the switch.  Having the dog be in the same spot as the bone after eating the bone would make the puzzle a little more intuitive.  Overall great job though!
Impressive for 10 hours! The aiming felt a bit odd at first but I got used to it. Funny mechanic with the competing girl that is scared of the dog. Well done!

found it difficult to throw the bone on the weight activated thing without the dog catching it . I mean I guess i could've gotten separation from the dog first but that required running the dog into a wall while I'm still moving just extremely frustrating mechanics. but did fit the criteria i guess you did have an animal...you did have a projectile although your animal refused to let land where i needed it to and it did have a story.

I love the hand-drawn look and the interaction between our character and Meep is great.  Meep is indeed a good boy.  I'm afraid I wasn't very good at the game, but I found it all very charming none-the-less.  Well done and actually very impressive for 10 hours.
Pretty fun concept! One of the few games I've seen where the intro text is a bit too fast :D
Great game for only 10h. Meep would often not listen to me lol but that's to be expected within the time. I did a playthrough with max attraction to see what would happen and found the text funny

Great work! I liked the story and I absolutely loved the art style. The platforming was sound, although the dog system and the attraction system could have used more time in the oven. Overall, I give it a B for 'Balentimes Day.' If the projectile throwing system and dog were improved that would move it up to a solid 'A' for 'Adorable.'
Very impressive for only 10 hours work. You stuck to the criteria and I can't really argue with the results. Great job!

For being made in 10 hours this was pretty good. The dog felt a bit unwieldy, my main issues being having to go back and get it along with throwing a bone with them by me and it instantly disappearing. I also wished that meep, and in turn the animals and projectiles, had been used a bit more considering you only really needed it for that one button and can jump over the girls. I also think that having the camera ahead of the player was a good idea but it was a little too far ahead which made any situation in which you need to see or move back feel awkward. The story was cute and funny although I do maybe wish it made a little more sense than the girlfriend spreading treasure chests throughout the city. It was charming but it's also hard to connect with goofy stories and they should stay somewhat rooted in reality. I think this game did a good job addressing all of the different criteria, and well I don't think any of the elements it's being judged on were done phenomenally I think that they worked well together and made a complete product, so good job!

This was a fun, cute game. Made in 10 hours is pretty good. Loved the puzzles and I can really see this expanded on into something great. You got a good story, a fun projectile (much like in my game), an animal that helps you solve the puzzles, and a fun game. Good work!

Fun game especially for only doing it in 10 hours. It was actually pretty funny and wouldve been amazing with some extra puzzles. Als if you jump on platforms your dog can get stuck and stay below you, this awesome feature could create some cool puzzles.
Was great to play on stream! Thanks for submitting! Please feel free to watch for comments there (around 01:26:41)

Cute story! It's impressive what you made in only 10 hours. The game is a little buggy unfortunately - sometimes throwing the bone had no response. You need to press jump and follow so Meep will jump with you, but sometimes Meep won't jump no matter what. Sometimes Meep jumps but falls weirdly slowly.
I initially was going to rate this game 0 stars, but then I read your very convincing pitch. 5 stars on everything now!
Fun game! I love the mechanic of Pitandra being too enamored by doggo to seduct lol. genius
Nice story addition to a very nice game.

I remember really loving this from the first round.  But, I was a little confused this time.  I couldn't get past the first screen.  I put squares all over the map and tried to highlight where I thought the mines were, but I guess I wasn't doing it right.  I think with a slightly better tutorial, this would be awesome.
Gotta say I like this more in the context of a story than just a puzzle game. Well done.
the is in ok state

This was one of my favorites from round 1, but I'm not sure it was as well executed this time around. I wasn't able to make it past the third minefield as it was a vertical strip and I only had those horizontal items left over by that point. And then the game froze on me. Which is a bummer because the idea has a ton of potential and you've already put in most of the ground work.

I think I understand the game? It's hard to tell because there's not much player feedback other than to door disappearing. A solid tutorial would bring this to the finish line in my opinion. I love the idea, but for me, the execution just wasn't quite there. From reading the other comments, it sounds like there's a lot of unfinished parts, which is a bummer for the jam, but I'm super interested in what happens with this in the future!

This was my favorite game during the first game so I'm glad you decided to explore the concept a little more. This is basically a puzzle mode with minesweeper and I'm surprised how well the story mode goes together with it.

I'm already bad at minesweeper, but this game is so confusing to me. I swear I tried every way I could to understand how to deal with the first tunnel, but I only get through on what seemed as random chance. I'll definitely come back to this when there's some clarification on what I need to do!

I really liked the idea behind the original submission. I was looking forward to playing a refined version but as the game is currently it is very confusing. I âsolvedâ the first puzzle by trial and error but then didnât know what to do in the narrow passage. I know where the mine is but it wonât go away unless I clikc on it and die. I bet there is a strategy that I am missing. Could you add some clarification in the game page?
This was a great add on from round 1, liked it a lot!

Really awesome! I love how you managed to bring snake into this game, a bit more unsure about the projectiles (I don't think they 100% fit) but you managed it very well! Collecting the pages was a fun objective, although it meant I got to learn the mechanics in a bit of an weird order, so I had to figure things out myself instead.Even so, I still felt motivated to play through the whole thing, and it never felt too hard or too easy.
This is awesome, I love the Tunic style handbook!!
The improvement between the first and second round is pretty incredible. I did get stuck though. Where do I use the projectiles? Great work!
This game is so insanely polished and professionally.  I feel like I can learn so much from you and your level design.
Man, your game is just perfect.

Very unique gameplay mechanic! I had 5 pieces and found 7 or 8 pages before I got too frustrated with the pacing and controls, it takes a lot of effort to get anywhere and I didn't feel like exploring further because of that. But mechanically speaking, this game is excellent :D well done!
hi nice work you realy made the game betterunforchanatly i dint saw any animals andprojectiles in thegamebut like the game
I still really like these puzzler game mechanics. No notes from me on this round, very well done!

Really cool game. It's awesome the way that the flat block shoots and that the blocks can control the snake was unexpected but brilliant. It took me a while to get the snake in the right shape to climb it but I got there in the end and the secret entrance was really good too!
My brain is not big enough for this game. I still loved it. I'll make my brain bigger, then try and finish it.

puzzle design is brilliant and there's no better feeling than mastering the controls in this and then moving around seamlessly especially when there's callbacks to patterns. really like how you navigated the task and transformed a winning title into something even better!

Metroidvania gang!! This game was great, follows up Shift Shape magnificently.  The projectiles and animals were incorporated so well, some of the continued games from round 1 felt like they had the themes shoved in but I think they make the game much better here. The snakes were cool as they force the player to sort of make their own puzzles and the projectiles added an interesting level of positioning. Some things I did felt really unintended but I think that just made it much more fun to do. My only complaint was that moving around felt kind of slow which led me to not want to backtrack much, the shortcut in snake tower is great but other than that going from one end of the map to another just takes a while. With some more mechanics and variety I could absolutely see a full metroidvania in this, amazing job.
Nice work!  Very relaxing experience
Gosh! Another spectacular entry to the Shift Shape saga! The concepts for the animal and projectiles are soooo well conceived and the atmosphere perfectly matches the intended vibe. 10/10
Woah! Great work! I love the unique storytelling and the gameplay mechanics. With some work, this game could become a classic puzzle platformer.
Really fun and engaging game :) Good job.

Amazing game like I said in Discord! I played it again as intended. I still can't find the 13th page though. My only complaint is that the projectile shooting is a little clunky to use, which works great for the puzzle-like feel of the game, but it felt slightly repetitive in the projectile tower when there were a lot of blocks to shoot.
I had a great time playing it, it's a lot of fun!
Great job!! I feel like the camera rotation effects really helped give a sense of speed.  This was chaotic in the best ways.
Game is fun, game is cool, but tooo fast for me xD

Wow, the sense of speed here was incredible.  I would have these awesome moments when I felt like I was flying, but then I would crash and burn hard (I'm just not that good).  I would love to see someone with more skill than me play this game.  Great soundtrack for it (one of the best I've heard) and strong characters.  Well done.

Without question, the best platformer I've played so far! Loved the characters, they were just fun to listen to. My main issue was that there are a TON of areas where you just have to restart because you didn't do down a ramp fast enough. There were also a good amount of times I died because the speed you need to clear some areas removes all the reaction time I have. Beyond that, this is an amazing game. Fantastic work!

Incredible fast paced action and you should be proud of yourself for making such a cool game. The art style and everything really came together nicely. I think my only real criticism is it can feel at times almost a little to chaotic, I think you just need to really hammer down on what the main mechanics are and stick with them. I thought it was brilliant though, I was thoroughly impressed with how much you've managed to achieve in the time since you started developing this idea. Great job and keep it up!

Very fast and chaotic, reminds me the old Sonic games where you have no idea where you're going and you hit a bunch of walls and slow down and you have to die a lot to figure out when you have to tap the jump button or take another action. Not my favorite kind of game but it was fun. Good work!

I enjoyed my playthrough! Very chaotic and some parts just flew by without me even knowing what was going on or whether I missed something, but I managed to make it to the temporary end credits without any softlocks :D I disliked the last level the most, because it felt more like trial and error while the earlier two levels were more fun to go through imo. I liked the animal mechanics a lot. The camera is a bit rough at times, and sometimes I'd rather have it zoomed out a little more so I'd have a chance to see where I'm going at warp speed, but I understand it's part of the charm of the game this is inspired by, and to just enjoy the ride :D

Excellent work! I had a few moments where I got softlocked and had to restart but for the most part it was really fun and well paced. I did get a bit nauseous at times because of the camera tilting left and right and I wish there was some option to turn it on / off or adjust how much. Otherwise, it's a really solid entry, great art, great story, great mechanics, great job!

This was cool! There are a few areas where you can get softlocked, and sometimes the camera is zoomed out perfectly, other times it's not zoomed out enough to see everything needed. All in all, those are small issues that have simple fixes. Great job!

Hi, Incredible game but I just couldnt complete it with the controls :/ I did watch your speedrun video (wish you could make one where the story is readable tho since I missed that) and its amazing how much stuff youve added. In general I would always allow arrow keys since im on azerty it was very hard to use W to pick up. also just allowing E for pickup wouldve made it easier on my hands. Other then that its a very cool game and I know for a fact those sliding mechanics arent easy to make so good job!
Damn this was a fantastic game! I loved this game! Felt like sonic :D
my internet is back on! Had to check this one first!

Great game with amazing art! I love how smooth the movement feels. The gameplay feels very fast-paced and fun. I like the story as well. I think I accidentally got soft-locked - there was no way to kill the living bird and respawning didn't change anything, so I had to restart the whole game. Other than that, amazing game. Good job!

This game was a ton of fun when it was at it's best. The controls felt really good and I love the ducks and using them to rocket jump. I think the end of the story was very abrupt but I might have missed something in the last level as I rocket jumped accidently straight into the end from decently far away. The animals, mostly the duck, were fun to use but didn't really seem 'animal.' The only animal who's ability lines up with what I would guess is the bird that allows you to glide. But for some reason hitting a dead bird teleports you to it and the lizard shoots bullets and the ducks explode, these could be anything besides animals and they'd make more sense. I also only used the lizard during the lizard tutorial where it forces you to, mostly because it has no mobility use besides shooting birds and that use isn't worth the fact that I don't know how to drop it and can't pick up other animals D:
Very fun! Love the mechanics, the flow of movement and the cutscenes! The use of the animals is all really fleshed out and works crisply

The movement feels great, you did amazing work in this round and this game fits very well with the task and more importantly you managed to continue on the same universe and made "part two" with a different character. Really awesome work! I have some nit-picks which don't affect my judgement (the game is at least top 10% in my opinion)

Cute game! The storytelling is by far my favorite part! Is very clean and reads well.I think the aiming could do with some work though. It feels a bit awkward to have to use both WASD and arrows in this way personally, and might have preferred if it was either tied to mouse position or just in the player's facing direction.I also noticed that its easier to get through the game without fighting any enemies, so may be something to consider for the future.Still loved it tho!
19 seconds! Fun game!
This game is good at telling a story without words. The art is good too.

That was fun. I actually managed a pacifist run after going through throwing birds at everything :)

I really like the setting and art of the game, it's a top down shooter where if you're systematic you will never have to run from anything. I did kind of forget to check the loot from the killed rabbits, but once the ending hit it did make perfect sense, while still being a plot twist, good job!The game itself felt quite tedious though, and I would've closed it at level three if this wasn't a story round (many other people will miss the ending though). It worked well and felt interesting the first three levels but after that it didn't really bring anything new(could also be cause I didn't check the dropped of stuff, so I missed a bit of story there). Especially the increased search area made it feel very slow. That being said, the slow nature of the game also fits into the narrative, with this being your "day to day job".The game would've been perfect if there was 3 levels instead of five, so well done!

Let me start with the positive - the art and atmosphere are gorgeous. The story was fairly engaging and kept me playing. That being said, the game didn't really come together for me. This is probably a personal thing, but I felt kind of bored throughout the whole game. First of all, the gameplay was pretty repetitive and menial. I think that expanding the map wasn't a great choice as it just increased the tedium of finding the right rabbits, maybe having more variations or rabbits that look more similar to one another, to make it more risky to play. I think having a menial task like this as the main game loop could serve as a great vessel for horror but my other issue was that the game wasn't scary, and I think there's a lot of reasons why. Firstly there's no actual indication that you are in danger. The music is still calm and the vibes are still immaculate. There was at least one moment where there was a monster chasing me and I didn't notice. Having some adaptive music, maybe a tint on the screen or a vignette would have gone a long way. The other thing is that the monsters are complete nonthreats. I don't think I got hit once over both my playthroughs (during the jam and right now). They are way slower than the player, and not only that but shooting knocks them back and stuns them. Something I did in my first round game was have the monster increase slowly in speed, creating moments on tension where they're close but then you pull ahead but then they start getting closer. This forces you to get out of danger as quickly as possible too. Finally, there's never a moment where you are actually forced into danger. If you are just careful while playing, even if you don't know to avoid them, you might not encounter a single threat.

Fun game, satisfied all criteria, and great work on the particle effects. You are just 13, you have great future ahead :)
This was a good submission! I can tell that you worked hard on the enemy pathfinding and stuff. All around, pretty good for such a short game!

Pretty silly but ultimately fun story :D the chickens weren't much of a threat, except for that congaline that showed up when you jumped down a cliff in one of the later levels :') and I liked that there was a boss at the end.

The art was cute and the story was simple but enough to make the game feel complete. I think that the animals made the simple platformer a lot more engaging but I didn't feel myself shooting really at all, considering the enemies were predictable and not actively aggressive whilst also being tanky enough that they are annoying to kill. I think the game could have used a bit more variety, maybe with the platformer controller from r1 to add some more movement options for example, but there were not enough levels that it really felt like it dragged on. Cheesed the boss by standing in the corner and shooting but it was still a nice addition and way to end the game. I had some issues shooting while changing direction, which is actually another reason why I didn't fight enemies as you can't run away and then quickly turn around to shoot. I did think that the animations were very cute though and I think that the game did come together as a complete product, nice job!
Good Job.
Nice aesthetic and color palette. I appreciate the details in the animation, especially the smoke coming out of the gun when its on cooldown.
I love the game boy colour palette. Great character design and the death animations for the chickens were cool. The story was pretty funny also and I enjoyed playing this game. Well done!
Was great to play on stream and have you there popping in!
Fun game with graphics and a palette I love. Good story, well done.
Music is good, the story is funny and meggech was cool! It fits the criteria nicely good job

Your character design and name is fantastic and I love the art style. I liked the boss fight too and it was great watching it bouncing around trying to squash me. As others have said, I also wasn't able to read the text fast enough
nice music! I liked how everything was straight to the point. No frills.The text is a little difficult to read, though.
Very charming color and style! So OG gameboy-esqueI love the story too haha! Simple and sweet
good game looks cool unforchunatly no story,
Fun game!

This was an interesting platformer with a fun backstory.  Unfortunately, I was terrible at this game.  Everything moved so fast and I died on the spikes so many times.  I wish there were difficulty levels.  I'm sure others were brilliant at it though and I just need to practice more.  Good job.
I really enjoyed this game in the fisrt round. Nice to see how it's grown since then. Good job :)

movement was very fluent loved the use of the projectiles. kinda for some reason took me back to good old crash bandicoot. the original one thank god it wasn't as hard though. wish there was a bit more of a story i saw that you used more context then directly telling what is happening which is always a neat way to tell a story and as the development process well... develops...the story will unravel  but this has some real potential

The platforming controls themselves have a had a major improvement from Round 1! That being said, I deeply miss the old system of collecting animals an items. They allowed for so much creativity and cool problem solving options! The new system of shooting things to make them bigger is just, in my humble opinion, a much less interesting concept. Regardless, still a good platformer!

Platforming was super responsive and the level design was super clean. I liked how you had to shoot the animals and mushrooms to embiggen them. The backtracking portion was made really clear with the camera panning and clever foreshadowing. The last platforming bit was super challenging and precise but I got it eventually.
I see you removed the ability to pick up animals, to now just make them bigger.
I find it a bit hard to hit stuff as bullets feel a bit small, but liked it anyway :) good job
loved it!i dont really have a  lot to say but you made this game very wellgreat work!!

Everything came together quite nicely! I found the hitboxes for the spikes to be wayyy to large compared to their sprites, which was a bit annoying when riding a snail across but horrible when traversing up the part with the angled spikes. The animals and projectiles work really well together but I don't really know what the story was. The art and music was simple but consistent and an enjoyable enough vessel for the gameplay. Overall, nice job!
Pretty sweet. I like how you switched things up from the round 1 entry because I remember really enjoying that one too! Keep going!
Very cool game!
The platforming and shooting were fun and a bit challenging. I think you got everything in there as far as the challenge of the round and it's a fun game.
This is cool! Very chill guy energy.
